commit_message:
Dig vips out from network metadata

In order to prevent the refer to an empty vips for virt/compute roles
(there are no controllers in cluster yet) fallback to default values.

commit_message:
Use Firefox for JS unit tests

PhantomJS has setup issues and is slowing down the gate with false
failures. We should change to Firefox until Phantom is more
reliable, at which point this patch can be reverted.

Closes-Bug: 1568325
Co-Authored-By: Richard Jones <r1chardj0n3s@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I1cf0a1089a9dbb0f66d390c7ec54660e8ee4ae0d

subject: Fix: unable to delete instance when cinder is down
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-03 04:40:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix: unable to delete instance when cinder is down

Ignore any cinder related exceptions that arise when you try to delete
an instance, so that the delete instance workflow isn't abruptly
interrupted (skipping necessary clean-up, etc).

In this case, we are intentionally catching all exceptions in addition
to a specific set of exceptions, so that the instance and related
resources aren't left in an unmanageable state when an unexpected
exception occurs. For example, currently you can't delete an instance
that's attached to a volume when cinder is down.

The existing error messages were also updated to include the block
device mapping volume id that triggered the exception.

Change-Id: Iba7b4cc4b59f88b0817c4618e7a4429161d6c2a9
Closes-Bug: #1563547
(cherry picked from commit 27e869bb88f13d05b94107a769f67ddd6975425d)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: unable to delete instance when cinder is down

Ignore any cinder related exceptions that arise when you try to delete
an instance, so that the delete instance workflow isn't abruptly
interrupted (skipping necessary clean-up, etc).

In this case, we are intentionally catching all exceptions in addition
to a specific set of exceptions, so that the instance and related
resources aren't left in an unmanageable state when an unexpected
exception occurs. For example, currently you can't delete an instance
that's attached to a volume when cinder is down.

The existing error messages were also updated to include the block
device mapping volume id that triggered the exception.

Change-Id: Iba7b4cc4b59f88b0817c4618e7a4429161d6c2a9
Closes-Bug: #1563547
(cherry picked from commit 27e869bb88f13d05b94107a769f67ddd6975425d)

commit_message:
Fix launch vm failed in neutron-linuxbridge-agent env

Fix following two issues

* neutron-linuxbridge-agent container lacks bridge-utils package
* neutron-dhcp-agent container lacks dnsmasq-utils

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia <manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1567406
Change-Id: I93a445b06612671f0331cd94573da41d2d3b60a0
(cherry picked from commit eec09486a37299edb7c18b8d3345c164c338ba55)

subject: Fixes bug where the updated federated display_name is not returned
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 15:38:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/identity/core.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py'], 'message': 'Fixes bug where the updated federated display_name is not returned

When shadowing a federated user, if the display name is changed, it
should get updated and returned in the user name attribute.  This patch
fixes a bug where the display_name was getting updated, but not the old
display_name was being returned.

Closes-Bug: #1566494

Change-Id: I155d3a9e4c90a3d22d0b30e35276c9ddbb65ae6d
(cherry picked from commit 562b81dd4a94d5a219b7cf1ff2f82288add10046)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes bug where the updated federated display_name is not returned

When shadowing a federated user, if the display name is changed, it
should get updated and returned in the user name attribute.  This patch
fixes a bug where the display_name was getting updated, but not the old
display_name was being returned.

Closes-Bug: #1566494

Change-Id: I155d3a9e4c90a3d22d0b30e35276c9ddbb65ae6d
(cherry picked from commit 562b81dd4a94d5a219b7cf1ff2f82288add10046)

commit_message:
Fix setting peer to bridge interfaces

OVSDB implementation refuses to set options:peer column value
as there is no such column in the Interface table. The correct way
is to set 'options' column value to a map containing key 'peer', as
already used in ovs_lib.

Change-Id: Ib5e956f425b36f54cda017c91ac71d9d7ee9747c
Closes-Bug: 1528894
(cherry picked from commit d130245967fa4d31fd54eaede38c3fdb42d51916)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-01-12 19:10:43.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py', 'keystone/token/providers/common.py', 'keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Validate domain ownership for v2 tokens"

This reverts commit 9dfad21201251364c6d205e8e79813bfe78e6107.

This revert is being proposed as it breaks behavior that
real-world deployments rely on. The deployments requested the V2 token
with user_id and tenantId and then used the V2 token for the
non-default-domain user to access swift.

While the deployment is being encouraged to fix their code to
use V3, this is behavior that was supported and used.

Closes-Bug: 1527759
Change-Id: I4a303a5fcc8c2dacef5960e9e26ad9402f34a790'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Validate domain ownership for v2 tokens"

This reverts commit 9dfad21201251364c6d205e8e79813bfe78e6107.

This revert is being proposed as it breaks behavior that
real-world deployments rely on. The deployments requested the V2 token
with user_id and tenantId and then used the V2 token for the
non-default-domain user to access swift.

While the deployment is being encouraged to fix their code to
use V3, this is behavior that was supported and used.

Closes-Bug: 1527759
Change-Id: I4a303a5fcc8c2dacef5960e9e26ad9402f34a790

commit_message:
networking guide: added info about path_mtu option

This option can be used for ML2 plugin to specify MTU for tunneled
networks that is different from the global one, similar to
physical_network_mtus for VLAN/flat networking.

Change-Id: I34a0a74d734ee8b7850b6aed75f7b066f13b2bb8
Related-Bug: #1552089
Related-Bug: #1454328

commit_message:
Fix beaker test with package_provider error.

This commit[1] in puppet-stdlib adds the package_provider.  Since
puppetlabs-stdlib 4.11 in pulled out of the repo[2], it has this patch.
The declaration of the $package_provider variable is no longer possible.
This patch removes it and uses the fact.

Closes-Bug: 1568983

[1] https://github.com/puppetlabs/puppetlabs-stdlib/commits/e1a9bf506359d1e84d13b857ca6fa5e556ceeddd
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/90/304190/1/check/gate-puppet-openstacklib-puppet-beaker-rspec-centos-7/9a2160a/console.html#_2016-04-11_15_55_23_678

Change-Id: I61edd49393694f2627cbe07064013dd75eef11a9

commit_message:
Values for [ml2]/physical_network_mtus should not be unique

Obviously there could be physical networks with same MTU.
The patch sets unique_values to False when parsing physical_network_mtus
Unit test added.

Closes-Bug: #1567502
Change-Id: I46e5b5d3f7033a974fca40342af6dff7c71a9a4a
(cherry picked from commit 5cdd7ae574312a7499a8768c1752d9bc27ff7d20)

commit_message:
Fix launch vm failed in neutron-linuxbridge-agent env

Fix following two issues

* neutron-linuxbridge-agent container lacks bridge-utils package
* neutron-dhcp-agent container lacks dnsmasq-utils

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia <manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Closes-Bug: #1567406
Change-Id: I93a445b06612671f0331cd94573da41d2d3b60a0

commit_message:
Create /var/cache/swift in source installation

Due to lack of /var/cache/swift directory, swift services
are unable to access /var/cache/swift/container.recon file.

Closes-Bug: 1569182

Change-Id: Ifc4763d40256e43f51728e1dd4b3986c4f0ba0fc

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-04-11 15:38:07.000000000', 'files': ['tools/setup_nodes.yml'], 'message': 'Make sure /etc/hostname is valid for SELinux

In the gate, it is possible for /etc/hostname to not have a valid
SELinux security conext. So, reset them to default before we update
the hostname to avoid:

  TASK: [Assign hostname]
  failed: [node1] => {"failed": true}
  msg: Command failed rc=1, out=, err=Could not set property: Access
  denied

Closes-Bug: #1568047
Change-Id: Ie30c8437b310d1ea5bc75307375c255131dfe934
Needed-By: I2ff5fbb315832b8cf07c93d0dd0cdaacd958631e
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure /etc/hostname is valid for SELinux

In the gate, it is possible for /etc/hostname to not have a valid
SELinux security conext. So, reset them to default before we update
the hostname to avoid:

  TASK: [Assign hostname]
  failed: [node1] => {"failed": true}
  msg: Command failed rc=1, out=, err=Could not set property: Access
  denied

Closes-Bug: #1568047
Change-Id: Ie30c8437b310d1ea5bc75307375c255131dfe934
Needed-By: I2ff5fbb315832b8cf07c93d0dd0cdaacd958631e

commit_message:
Make sync_db_api enabled by default

According to the release notes[0], in Mitaka a second database
specifically for the api is required. Flip sync_db_api to being
true by default.

[0] "Nova now requires that two databases are available and configured.
The existing nova database needs no changes, but a new nova_api database
needs to be setup."
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/nova/mitaka.html

Change-Id: Ia5fa8ba70b7ce151e7e904f5e8f94658a98dd295

commit_message:
ovs: move code from plugin into linux_net helper

The ovs plugin has a bunch of direct calls to the
processutils.execute() method. This will make it
hard to apply privsep annotations, so move them
all out into helper methods in linux_net

Change-Id: I7efa532541651849be5be42c58e86645cbebaa67

commit_message:
Containerize TripleO deployments blueprint

This is an initial work that aims to identify why and how to run
OpenStack in containers by using TripleO.

This is highly work in progress, and hopefully will be used as a support
during Mitaka summit to help us in taking technical decisions.

Change-Id: I914eaddd6c1251011a0fec9c44fc677255f446fe

subject: Fix problems in glossary
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 12:44:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/glossary.rst'], 'message': 'Fix problems in glossary

This patch corrects some errors found in glossary:
- Actions are triggered via receivers, not webhooks.
- Nested clusters are something we yet to support, better remove them
  for the moment.
- Webhooks are no longer an encapsulation of tuples. They are needles in
  a hack for users to trigger an operation. That is, if you know the
  URI, you can always trigger an action.

Change-Id: I6b209fbb20f1a3d7add91e3477fdddcd8d65f15e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix problems in glossary

This patch corrects some errors found in glossary:
- Actions are triggered via receivers, not webhooks.
- Nested clusters are something we yet to support, better remove them
  for the moment.
- Webhooks are no longer an encapsulation of tuples. They are needles in
  a hack for users to trigger an operation. That is, if you know the
  URI, you can always trigger an action.

Change-Id: I6b209fbb20f1a3d7add91e3477fdddcd8d65f15e

subject: Set the values for the request_local_cache
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 09:49:22.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/cache/_context_cache.py'], 'message': 'Set the values for the request_local_cache

Instead of only using the request_local_cache when an explicit set
occurs, make sure we always set the value for the request_local_cache
when we have to reach for the proxied backend.

The Context Local cache was being used previously when we were seeing
a mix of cache misses and hits. This change ensures we now always
set the value(s) as expected:

Change-Id: I4857cfe1e62d54c3c89a0206ffc895c4cf681ce5
Closes-Bug: #1567403
'}]
commit_message:
Set the values for the request_local_cache

Instead of only using the request_local_cache when an explicit set
occurs, make sure we always set the value for the request_local_cache
when we have to reach for the proxied backend.

The Context Local cache was being used previously when we were seeing
a mix of cache misses and hits. This change ensures we now always
set the value(s) as expected:

Change-Id: I4857cfe1e62d54c3c89a0206ffc895c4cf681ce5
Closes-Bug: #1567403

commit_message:
Change number of horizon specific haking rule

Current is M3**, change to D3**. 'D' is the first capital from 'Dashboard'.
It's more informative and could be distinguished from 'H'
which is using for openstack-dev/hacking rules.

Closes-Bug: #1537641

commit_message:
Add AllServicesCurrent fixture

This adds a fixture that simulates a fully up-to-date system where
all services are current. This is the vast majority of what we test
for our unit tests, of course.

commit_message:
Remove virtualenv management scripts from oslo-incubator

This commit removes the old virtualenv management scripts from oslo
incubator. They were just wrappers around virtualenv and don't really
work well in a world with global requirements and constraints. This
commit just removes them since there isn't any reason to keep them
around.

Change-Id: Ib7dd6b34533880e48b367732ae3520026a92500e

The test job "gate-tempest-dsvm-cells" uses the Nova cells concept.
This triggered a deprecation warning:

    Option "rabbit_virtual_host" from group "DEFAULT" is deprecated.
    Use option "rabbit_virtual_host" from group "oslo_messaging_rabbit".

This change removes that warning.

subject: Create signing_dir upon first usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 18:12:07.000000000', 'files': ['keystonemiddleware/auth_token/_signing_dir.py', 'keystonemiddleware/tests/unit/auth_token/test_signing_dir.py'], 'message': "Create signing_dir upon first usage

Without this patch, if a signing_dir value is not provided in the
keystone_authtoken section for a given service, keystonemiddleware will
create a secure temporary directory upon startup. For users not using
the 'pki' pr 'pkiz' token providers, this is unnecessary and causes
/tmp to fill up needlessly. This patch moves the directory
creation out of SigningDirectory.__init__ and into
SigningDirectory.calc_path, so that the first time calc_path is called,
the directory is created. If the user has provided the directory name,
we still log that and verify the directory at __init__. If the temp
directory must be created, we log and verify that only once at the time
of creation.

Change-Id: I501d96d35bcf0039d2f5c5987471f496fc830f61
Closes-bug: #1533724
"}]
commit_message:
Create signing_dir upon first usage

Without this patch, if a signing_dir value is not provided in the
keystone_authtoken section for a given service, keystonemiddleware will
create a secure temporary directory upon startup. For users not using
the 'pki' pr 'pkiz' token providers, this is unnecessary and causes
/tmp to fill up needlessly. This patch moves the directory
creation out of SigningDirectory.__init__ and into
SigningDirectory.calc_path, so that the first time calc_path is called,
the directory is created. If the user has provided the directory name,
we still log that and verify the directory at __init__. If the temp
directory must be created, we log and verify that only once at the time
of creation.

Change-Id: I501d96d35bcf0039d2f5c5987471f496fc830f61
Closes-bug: #1533724

subject: Run db-sync before we manage neutron services
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-12 21:04:00.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_agents_ml2_ovs_spec.rb', 'manifests/agents/ml2/ovs.pp'], 'message': 'Run db-sync before we manage neutron services

  This commit puts in place a dependency between db-sync and the
  neutron-ovs-agent-service service.

  This is specially being done because in Puppet 4 tests we are seeing
  the neutron-ovs-agent-service trying to start before the int-br-ex
  related rows are being added to the neutron db.

Change-Id: Ifc3f40ae1cb71c215b8a0bf6cd5f6d05101a6168
'}]
commit_message:
Run db-sync before we manage neutron services

  This commit puts in place a dependency between db-sync and the
  neutron-ovs-agent-service service.

  This is specially being done because in Puppet 4 tests we are seeing
  the neutron-ovs-agent-service trying to start before the int-br-ex
  related rows are being added to the neutron db.

Change-Id: Ifc3f40ae1cb71c215b8a0bf6cd5f6d05101a6168

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-12 15:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_k8s_bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_mesos_bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/test_utils.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/test_template_definition.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_swarm_bay_conductor.py'], 'message': "Fix uuid cases with real UUID

From http://logs.openstack.org/64/302064/6/check/
gate-magnum-python27/6c92a13/console.html the log clearly
said bay-xx-xx-xx-xx is an invalid UUID. Using UUIDFields

Co-Authored-By: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix uuid cases with real UUID

From http://logs.openstack.org/64/302064/6/check/
gate-magnum-python27/6c92a13/console.html the log clearly
said bay-xx-xx-xx-xx is an invalid UUID. Using UUIDFields
with invalid UUIDs is no longer supported, so in our test
let's use real UUID case for that.

Change-Id: I0f3dbd8748293741cb5501365aee710220eb3ea0
Co-Authored-By: Spyros Trigazis <strigazi@gmail.com>

subject: generate_puppetfile: allow to deploy stable modules
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 19:24:38.000000000', 'files': ['generate_puppetfile.sh'], 'message': 'generate_puppetfile: allow to deploy stable modules

* If running this script under OpenStack Infra, read from ZUUL_BRANCH
  and try to deploy the Puppet OpenStack modules using the actual
  ZUUL_BRANCH if it exists, otherwise fallback to master.

* If running this script in your laptop with git, try to read from
  GIT_BRANCH variable, otherwise fallback to master.

This implementation avoid any hardcoding of OpenStack releases in the
script.

Change-Id: Icd834ea9d404a56d07f64ebd7c3715d94213e0d1
'}]
commit_message:
generate_puppetfile: allow to deploy stable modules

* If running this script under OpenStack Infra, read from ZUUL_BRANCH
  and try to deploy the Puppet OpenStack modules using the actual
  ZUUL_BRANCH if it exists, otherwise fallback to master.

* If running this script in your laptop with git, try to read from
  GIT_BRANCH variable, otherwise fallback to master.

This implementation avoid any hardcoding of OpenStack releases in the
script.

Change-Id: Icd834ea9d404a56d07f64ebd7c3715d94213e0d1

subject: Fix new Swift UI to work with Ceph backend
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-05 09:44:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/api/rest/swift.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/swift.py'], 'message': "Fix new Swift UI to work with Ceph backend

First, tolerate missing '/info' API endpoint, which Ceph doesn't
support yet. Second, `content_type` attribute on objects may be not
set, don't rely heavily on it.

Change-Id: I101338aa9c96a6551bfbf2dd9c460a4801b4e7b6
Closes-Bug: #1564834
(cherry picked from commit 80e52c1ae5e52abcc83c8efbb469a0d0ce020815)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix new Swift UI to work with Ceph backend

First, tolerate missing '/info' API endpoint, which Ceph doesn't
support yet. Second, `content_type` attribute on objects may be not
set, don't rely heavily on it.

Change-Id: I101338aa9c96a6551bfbf2dd9c460a4801b4e7b6
Closes-Bug: #1564834
(cherry picked from commit 80e52c1ae5e52abcc83c8efbb469a0d0ce020815)

subject: Refactor the port search logic
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-12 22:28:49.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Refactor the port search logic

Trying to combine len(ports) and nat_network logic led to weird
debugging. Split the two so that we don't try to search for a network to
attach the fip to if there is only one port on the server.

Change-Id: I1bc83e34a6f66cc5a8eb7ffa66f0288919210d4d
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor the port search logic

Trying to combine len(ports) and nat_network logic led to weird
debugging. Split the two so that we don't try to search for a network to
attach the fip to if there is only one port on the server.

Change-Id: I1bc83e34a6f66cc5a8eb7ffa66f0288919210d4d

subject: Allow passing nat_destination to get_active_server
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-12 22:28:49.000000000', 'files': ['shade/openstackcloud.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_create_server.py'], 'message': "Allow passing nat_destination to get_active_server

One of the code paths in which you might want to declare the
nat_destination is if you're calling get_active_server.

Change-Id: Idefc9aae6108c2dec926909bbf8f5d72baac13de
"}]
commit_message:
Allow passing nat_destination to get_active_server

One of the code paths in which you might want to declare the
nat_destination is if you're calling get_active_server.

Change-Id: Idefc9aae6108c2dec926909bbf8f5d72baac13de

commit_message:
Removed unused arguments

In the 'pipelines.py' file, there are two 'process_item' functions
in two classes. The two functions require a 'spider' parameter that
they are not using. There is a possibility other functions in other
places are also like so.

These unused arguments should be removed.

Closes-Bug: #1549267

subject: Downgrade docker-py from 1.8.0 to 1.7.2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 19:07:11.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Downgrade docker-py from 1.8.0 to 1.7.2

docker-py 1.8.0 introduced a dependency py2-ipaddress, which is
imcompatible with another dependency cryptography [1]. This issue
broke Magnum [2] so we need to downgrade docker-py to remove
py2-ipaddress for now.

Note that this is a short term solution. In the long term, we will
work with upstream community to resolve the module conflicting
issue.

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2870
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/
091916.html

Change-Id: I199c28017f8b18177b824e5594d09edd61798636
Related-Bug: #1568427
'}]
commit_message:
Downgrade docker-py from 1.8.0 to 1.7.2

docker-py 1.8.0 introduced a dependency py2-ipaddress, which is
imcompatible with another dependency cryptography [1]. This issue
broke Magnum [2] so we need to downgrade docker-py to remove
py2-ipaddress for now.

Note that this is a short term solution. In the long term, we will
work with upstream community to resolve the module conflicting
issue.

[1] https://github.com/pyca/cryptography/issues/2870
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-April/
091916.html

Change-Id: I199c28017f8b18177b824e5594d09edd61798636
Related-Bug: #1568427

[{'number': 11, 'created': '2016-04-08 13:58:03.000000000', 'files': ['specs/approved/oneview-drivers-dynamic-allocation.rst', 'specs/not-implemented/oneview-drivers-dynamic-allocation.rst'], 'message': 'Dynamic allocation of nodes on OneView drivers

commit_message:
Dynamic allocation of nodes on OneView drivers

This spec is about adding the ability to the OneView drivers of
dynamically allocate OneView resources to Ironic. The current
version of the drivers consider what we call "pre-allocation" of
nodes, meaning that when a node is registered in Ironic, even if
it is not in use, this resource is still reserved in OneView.
This change will prevent such situations by allocating OneView
resources only at boot time, allowing both systems to really
share the same pool of hardware.

Co-Authored-By: Sinval Vieira <sinval@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Gabriel Bezerra <gabrielb@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Thiago Paiva <thiagop@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

Change-Id: Iace4d6cec1744b59dd2b15c59e1b7306295e88aa
Partial-Bug: #1541096

commit_message:
Add nat_destination filter to floating IP creation

In Ansible 1.9.x 'quantum_floating_ip' module you have the option
to specify 'internal_network_name'. This allows you to set the name
of the network of the port to associate with the floating ip.

In Ansible 2.x 'os_floating_ip' you can't do that. This change
should bring the 'internal_network_name' option to be supported
for Ansible 2.x version.

Change-Id: I2c04a1feb5268a3621e35ed41a6af16622509325

commit_message:
Refactor guts of _find_interesting_networks

_find_interesting_networks is very sadly WAY too long and ugly. A
symptom of that was the code being all squished against the 80 column
line - but honestly the problem is that the code is so deep inside of
conditionals that figuring out what's going on is a bit madenning.

Split it out into another method so that the logic of whether we need to
do things can be isolated from the logic of doing things.

Change-Id: I4d5a30e3a5abd2b2f71e49dd18eab3eeb8f02f1d

subject: Search subnets for gateway_ip to discover NAT dest
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-04-12 20:00:47.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Search subnets for gateway_ip to discover NAT dest

The network that should be the target of the NAT of a floatingip should
have a subnet that has a gateway_ip. Ignore for a moment the
monumental insanity which is that data model ... that a network can have
one or more subnets, and a network_id is what a port has and is how you
describe what you want to attach to, but even with all of that the
gateway_ip is the cogent property and it's needs to be on all of the
subnets in the network. Just ignore that ... if you can.

Since that is the world we live in, we can discover which network is the
netowrk that has one or more subnets that has the gateway_ip set.

We'll still fail if there are more than one network that has a subnet
with gateway_ip set. But in that case, the config will take care of it.

Change-Id: Ib947081a6b7839e1a6f00dcbfd924cc99f19d0fd
"}]
commit_message:
Search subnets for gateway_ip to discover NAT dest

The network that should be the target of the NAT of a floatingip should
have a subnet that has a gateway_ip. Ignore for a moment the
monumental insanity which is that data model ... that a network can have
one or more subnets, and a network_id is what a port has and is how you
describe what you want to attach to, but even with all of that the
gateway_ip is the cogent property and it's needs to be on all of the
subnets in the network. Just ignore that ... if you can.

Since that is the world we live in, we can discover which network is the
netowrk that has one or more subnets that has the gateway_ip set.

We'll still fail if there are more than one network that has a subnet
with gateway_ip set. But in that case, the config will take care of it.

Change-Id: Ib947081a6b7839e1a6f00dcbfd924cc99f19d0fd

subject: Add pylint tox env
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 17:00:41.000000000', 'files': ['tools/lintstack.py', 'pylintrc', 'tools/lintstack.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add pylint tox env

Run pylint with

commit_message:
Fix prefixes output for subnet pool list

Fixed "os subnet pool list" command to properly disply the
list of subnet pool prefixes in the "Prefixes" column. This
fix is consistent with the "os subnet pool create" and
"os subnet pool show" command output.

Change-Id: I431d85c3b7f5bf8a327500decf3a15063fc5b120
Closes-Bug: #1569480

commit_message:
Revert "Add ability to configure heat-cfn keystone auth_name via hiera"

This reverts commit fad1a25e3e25ef4bb5dfd6f5afa153a49ee11a94.

The change has an incorrect puppet_manifest in the heat-cfn-keystone
task which causes deployments to fail.

Change-Id: Ie4b976d170b79c041a6979427806b0867d2b805d
Closes-Bug: #1569547

Currently, unit testcases of api emit FutureWarnings
from oslo.versionedobjects about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so
that when they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

Made changes to project_id in fakes.py to use valid project_id
which removes warnings related to invalid uuids in testcases.

Also made changes to project_id in JSON headers to use valid
uuids in functional testcases same as that in unit testcases.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Partial-Bug: #1557378
Change-Id: I5f69a2c3dc4d0279aed11750e6758b624debb64f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid uuid warnings in api testcases

Currently, unit testcases of api emit FutureWarnings
from oslo.versionedobjects about invalid uuids as documented here[1].

This commit changes these tests to use valid uuids so
that when they are run these warnings are no longer emitted.

Made changes to project_id in fakes.py to use valid project_id
which removes warnings related to invalid uuids in testcases.

Also made changes to project_id in JSON headers to use valid
uuids in functional testcases same as that in unit testcases.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.versionedobjects/api/fields.html#oslo_versionedobjects.fields.UUIDField

Partial-Bug: #1557378
Change-Id: I5f69a2c3dc4d0279aed11750e6758b624debb64f

commit_message:
Cleanup loadbalancer mgt and service ports

Adds a missing driver function to the LB driver to cleanup its management
and service ports on deletion or error, similar to the behavior of routers.

Closes-bug: #1567667
(cherry picked from commit 63a2a5978693a45cc796272191e69198c7373061)

commit_message:
DB API changes for the nova-manage quota_usage_refresh command

This is the first patch in a sequence to implement the
blueprint.

The patch implements the database API changes that will be
needed by the new nova-manage quota_usage_refresh command.

A new API is added to refresh the quota usages of the
selected resources.

Another API is added to get the PER_PROJECT_QUOTAS, which
will be needed later in the patch sequence.

Implements blueprint: refresh-quotas-usage

Change-Id: Id36328b2f2016eab2d7194b88d3eee8d016786d1

commit_message:
Check API versions intersects

Add new method to Controller class that checks
whether methods decorated with api_versions versions

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-04 12:33:02.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/irmc/test_boot.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/ilo/boot.py', 'ironic/drivers/modules/irmc/boot.py', 'ironic/tests/unit/drivers/modules/ilo/test_boot.py'], 'message': 'deployment vmedia ops should not be run when not deploying

When a conductor fail-over occurs, the conductor _do_takeover method
calls task.driver.deploy.prepare(). In some drivers, this results in
task.driver.boot.prepare_ramdisk() being called which when dealing
with virtual media, is inappropriate to do when not performing

Change-Id: Ief8dc385ccb67432eed05813ca266dd1e316575c
Closes-Bug: #1565104
'}]
commit_message:
deployment vmedia ops should not be run when not deploying

When a conductor fail-over occurs, the conductor _do_takeover method
calls task.driver.deploy.prepare(). In some drivers, this results in
task.driver.boot.prepare_ramdisk() being called which when dealing
with virtual media, is inappropriate to do when not performing
deployment operations as this can result in the deployment virtual
media being attached to a running host.

Change-Id: Ief8dc385ccb67432eed05813ca266dd1e316575c
Closes-Bug: #1565104

subject: Skip all types of service ports when creating allocation config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 15:21:46.000000000', 'files': ['astara/api/config/common.py', 'astara/common/constants.py', 'astara/test/unit/api/config/test_common_config.py', 'astara/test/unit/api/config/config_fakes.py', 'astara/api/neutron.py'], 'message': "Skip all types of service ports when creating allocation config

When astara creates allocation config, it has always skipped
service ports (historically VRRP ports), but it currently does not
skip LB ports.  This adds some constants where we can define astara's
service port labels and expand in the future, and takes these into
account when deciding which ports to leave out of allocation config.

Change-Id: I6d815b1e7e6e24120ad7fd9becc94a216bfb625b
Closes-bug: #1567163
(cherry picked from commit 968c7da141b28d52480fc8aa83f407ae5a76191a)
"}]
commit_message:
Skip all types of service ports when creating allocation config

When astara creates allocation config, it has always skipped
service ports (historically VRRP ports), but it currently does not
skip LB ports.  This adds some constants where we can define astara's
service port labels and expand in the future, and takes these into
account when deciding which ports to leave out of allocation config.

Change-Id: I6d815b1e7e6e24120ad7fd9becc94a216bfb625b
Closes-bug: #1567163
(cherry picked from commit 968c7da141b28d52480fc8aa83f407ae5a76191a)

commit_message:
go: hummingbird rescueparts

If there are some partitions in your cluster that need to be
replicated you can feed them to this command and it will send
priority replication calls out to all nodes in the ring to
fully replicate the partition if they have a copy of it.

Change-Id: Ic08366602107ccdcd8d615a5daacc2cd48a487e7

subject: Include newly-labelled HA router interfaces in network config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 15:22:02.000000000', 'files': ['astara/test/unit/api/test_neutron_wrapper.py', 'astara/api/neutron.py'], 'message': 'Include newly-labelled HA router interfaces in network config

Neutron very recently changed the device_owner field of router
interfaces on HA routers.  We need to account for this when
creating appliance network config, otherwise we omit HA interfaces
from its network config.

Change-Id: Ib41d4255f1ad3180c75f6e89ec6162dfdd0d2796
Closes-bug: #1567623
(cherry picked from commit 33edf3a58134a3e907f6892aba3bbe73594fab17)
'}]
commit_message:
Include newly-labelled HA router interfaces in network config

Neutron very recently changed the device_owner field of router
interfaces on HA routers.  We need to account for this when
creating appliance network config, otherwise we omit HA interfaces
from its network config.

Change-Id: Ib41d4255f1ad3180c75f6e89ec6162dfdd0d2796
Closes-bug: #1567623
(cherry picked from commit 33edf3a58134a3e907f6892aba3bbe73594fab17)

subject: Consume config values for NAT destination
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-11 23:29:22.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'requirements.txt', 'shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "Consume config values for NAT destination

In a cloud that has multiple private networks and that requires
floating IPs for public access, it's not possible to know which private
network the floating IP should NAT to without the user providing
some configuration. os-client-config added support for expressing
such a thing in 1.17.0, so start consuming that.

Change-Id: Iee634bcdc933a4c8d793ab9b25b27d9ecd77cdcc
"}]
commit_message:
Consume config values for NAT destination

In a cloud that has multiple private networks and that requires
floating IPs for public access, it's not possible to know which private
network the floating IP should NAT to without the user providing
some configuration. os-client-config added support for expressing
such a thing in 1.17.0, so start consuming that.

Change-Id: Iee634bcdc933a4c8d793ab9b25b27d9ecd77cdcc

commit_message:
Refactor IPAM ip allocation method

After taking some time going through this method to figure out what it
is really doing, I found it could be written with less tangled logic
and maybe I could save time for the next person to come along and try
to figure it out.

Also, I'm likely to do some more in this area as part of the routed
networks work and this will help.

Change-Id: I4d96ea8953fb811ec26c61d91ec9989e2b7a3216

commit_message:
publish puppet-aodh in tarball for master

This is an experimental thing for now, to get some feedback.
The idea is to follow other Python projects and publish a release of
Puppet Modules on tarballs server.

This first implementation will publish a tarball of puppet-aodh module
for each patch sent in master.

Change-Id: Iac61083ed3d0a587186dfe0ba6f61ae7f93a746a

api modules

This change renames the service api modules to be organized under the
sahara.service.api package. A v2 package has been added which holds the
equivalent v10 and v11 functions. To make the api version setup
transparent to the caller, the global OPS variable has been refactored
into the base sahara.service.api package.

Changes
* create sahara/service/api package
* rename sahara/service/api.py to sahara/service/api/v10.py
* rename sahara/service/edp/api.py to sahara/service/api/v11.py
* correct occurances of old imports in code and tests

  sahara/tests/unit/service/api/test_v10.py
* add initial v2 equivalents for current api services
* move global OPS object into the sahara.service.api package
* add documentation for the api service layer

Partial-Implements: bp v2-api-experimental-impl
Depends-On: I16918a30a862b42edd7a982caf555be618199ac3
Change-Id: Iefbedbc76ac620ff012bcaf536c17637b6252a15

commit_message:
rename service api modules

This change renames the service api modules to be organized under the
sahara.service.api package. A v2 package has been added which holds the
equivalent v10 and v11 functions. To make the api version setup
transparent to the caller, the global OPS variable has been refactored
into the base sahara.service.api package.

Changes
* create sahara/service/api package
* rename sahara/service/api.py to sahara/service/api/v10.py
* rename sahara/service/edp/api.py to sahara/service/api/v11.py
* correct occurances of old imports in code and tests
* rename sahara/tests/unit/service/test_api.py to
  sahara/tests/unit/service/api/test_v10.py
* add initial v2 equivalents for current api services
* move global OPS object into the sahara.service.api package
* add documentation for the api service layer

Partial-Implements: bp v2-api-experimental-impl
Depends-On: I16918a30a862b42edd7a982caf555be618199ac3
Change-Id: Iefbedbc76ac620ff012bcaf536c17637b6252a15

commit_message:
Set gcache.size to static value

- gcache.size shouldn't be calculated based on number of nodes. It's
  been set statically to 512M which is 2-4 hour of maintanance window.
  It should be enough to perform a maintenance. However, user may
  override the value in hiera
- Disable binlog as it was disabled and was enabled during debug session

Change-Id: I4e6cead09e3472fa570cef343532905f7da9b5ba
Closes-Bug: 1566440
Signed-off-by: Sergii Golovatiuk <sgolovatiuk@mirantis.com>
(cherry picked from commit c1b6c1f5385d96b010f955460c599998c247d7a0)

commit_message:
Support client certificate/key

This change enables to specify a client certificate/key with:
 * os-client-config config
 * Connection cert argument:
   * client certificate path via a string
   * client certificate/key paths via a tuple

Closes-Bug: #1569508
Related-Bug: #1569513
Change-Id: I657b19708fd45acaa705af6d877c50ef89df79fe

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 16:31:04.000000000', 'files': ['java/monasca-common-middleware/src/main/java/monasca/common/middleware/HttpAuthClient.java', 'java/monasca-common-middleware/src/main/java/monasca/common/middleware/TokenAuth.java'], 'message': "Don't log the entire token if auth failure

This change comes as a recommendation from our keystone
engineer, not good practice to log full tokens.  Also change
this log message:

'monasca.common.middleware.TokenAuth: 401 No token found.'

to debug level to avoid filling the log with these
messages as the result of a load balancer calling HEAD
without a token.

Change-Id: I6a04e98c398e163fb972020be1e580869b2538d7
"}]
commit_message:
Don't log the entire token if auth failure

This change comes as a recommendation from our keystone
engineer, not good practice to log full tokens.  Also change
this log message:

'monasca.common.middleware.TokenAuth: 401 No token found.'

to debug level to avoid filling the log with these
messages as the result of a load balancer calling HEAD
without a token.

Change-Id: I6a04e98c398e163fb972020be1e580869b2538d7

subject: Fix update to support extras
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 19:48:05.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_requirements/tests/test_update.py', 'openstack_requirements/cmds/update.py', 'openstack_requirements/requirement.py'], 'message': 'Fix update to support extras

When a requirement includes extras, the update script would remove
them. For example, a line like

 oslo.db[fixtures,mysql,postgresql]>=4.1.0 # Apache-2.0

was changed to

 oslo.db>=4.1.0 # Apache-2.0

The update script is fixed to leave the extras.

Change-Id: Ifd9637aa514d4c0872d0608b7d138e412426f9fd
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update to support extras

When a requirement includes extras, the update script would remove
them. For example, a line like

 oslo.db[fixtures,mysql,postgresql]>=4.1.0 # Apache-2.0

was changed to

 oslo.db>=4.1.0 # Apache-2.0

The update script is fixed to leave the extras.

Change-Id: Ifd9637aa514d4c0872d0608b7d138e412426f9fd

subject: Replace measurements table join with subquery that fits in memory
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2419, 'name': 'Roland Hochmuth', 'email': 'roland.hochmuth@hpe.com', 'username': 'roland-hochmuth-s'}, {'_account_id': 8126, 'name': 'Bradley Klein', 'email': 'bradley.klein@charter.com', 'username': 'bklei'}, {'_account_id': 11155, 'name': 'Ryan Bak', 'email': 'ryan.bak@twcable.com', 'username': 'ryanmbak'}, {'_account_id': 12512, 'name': 'Deklan Dieterly', 'email': 'deklan.dieterly@hpe.com', 'username': 'deklan'}, {'_account_id': 14273, 'name': 'Joe Keen', 'email': 'joe.keen@hpe.com', 'username': 'jkeen'}, {'_account_id': 14517, 'name': 'Ryan Brandt', 'email': 'ryan.brandt@hpe.com', 'username': 'ryan-brandt'}, {'_account_id': 16222, 'name': 'witek', 'email': 'witold.bedyk@suse.com', 'username': 'witek'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-11 21:38:09.000000000', 'files': ['java/src/main/java/monasca/api/infrastructure/persistence/vertica/MeasurementVerticaRepoImpl.java'], 'message': "Replace measurements table join with subquery that fits in memory

Our infrastructure project now has enough measurements in
vertica such that the inner join of the definitiondimensions
table to the measurements table no longer fits in memory --
making the measurements (not statistics) API a land mine.  We receive
the following vertica warning (8389):

'Join inner did not fit in memory [(MonMetrics.DefinitionDimensions x MonMetrics.Measurements)'

If a user loads a dashboard without applying a statistics function, it
can completely lock up monasca-api process and require a service restart.

This change removes the join and replaces with two more efficient
queries, more like the statistics interface.

Change-Id: I8e686bf2371e629809bc53b309c766848aaad827
Closes-Bug: #1565977
"}]
commit_message:
Replace measurements table join with subquery that fits in memory

Our infrastructure project now has enough measurements in
vertica such that the inner join of the definitiondimensions
table to the measurements table no longer fits in memory --
making the measurements (not statistics) API a land mine.  We receive
the following vertica warning (8389):

'Join inner did not fit in memory [(MonMetrics.DefinitionDimensions x MonMetrics.Measurements)'

If a user loads a dashboard without applying a statistics function, it
can completely lock up monasca-api process and require a service restart.

This change removes the join and replaces with two more efficient
queries, more like the statistics interface.

Change-Id: I8e686bf2371e629809bc53b309c766848aaad827
Closes-Bug: #1565977

commit_message:
Adds iscsid and tgtd docker containers

This partially implements iscsi and lvm2 support for cinder

There are some cases, like when using provider network or when we are
not using q-l3, where we don't create public or private network, thus we
need to check if such network's id exist before to create its probes,

commit_message:
Check for network id before create probe for neutron's network

There are some cases, like when using provider network or when we are
not using q-l3, where we don't create public or private network, thus we
need to check if such network's id exist before to create its probes,
otherwise devstack terminates prematurely.
Also add such probes for physical network.

Change-Id: I8892dae2d9d0d05af6ece96e26c7a68701214301
Closes-Bug: #1561421

commit_message:
Force iRMC vmedia boot from remotely connected CD/DVD

This patch forces iRMC vmedia boot from remotely connected
(redirected) CD/DVD using 'ipmitool raw' command instead of 'ipmitool
chassis bootdev cdrom'.

Closes-Bug: #1561852
Change-Id: I606e4d3a630ddc4eed071773afcb5274ee64a439

subject: Normalize operstate value for interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 15:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['os_net_config/utils.py'], 'message': 'Normalize operstate value for interfaces

The previous check for an interface operstate only looked for the
literal "UP" in caps, but in my environments I'm seeing operstate
returned as "up" in lower-case, which causes the _is_active_nic
check to fail incorrectly.  Example:

[root@overcloud-controller-0 heat-admin]# cat /sys/class/net/eth0/operstate
up

In this environment os-net-config is failing with the exception
in the linked bug.

Change-Id: I85c2d074ce43673c691523ca146ff7cdfdf1c7ca
Closes-Bug: 1569403
'}]
commit_message:
Normalize operstate value for interfaces

The previous check for an interface operstate only looked for the
literal "UP" in caps, but in my environments I'm seeing operstate
returned as "up" in lower-case, which causes the _is_active_nic
check to fail incorrectly.  Example:

[root@overcloud-controller-0 heat-admin]# cat /sys/class/net/eth0/operstate
up

In this environment os-net-config is failing with the exception
in the linked bug.

Change-Id: I85c2d074ce43673c691523ca146ff7cdfdf1c7ca
Closes-Bug: 1569403

commit_message:
Grub stage1 shall be installed on all of disks

Otherwise, under some conditions, first disk (hd0 or sda) could be
filtered out, thus making a node totally unbootable due to missing
bootloader code.

Change-Id: Ib28a821f17816e318db87df2bb9830bf3a157286
Closes-Bug: #1567930

subject: Show default attributes for queue
revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-04-12 01:20:28.000000000', 'files': ['zaqar/tests/unit/transport/wsgi/v2_0/test_queue_lifecycle.py', 'zaqar/transport/validation.py', 'zaqar/transport/wsgi/v2_0/queues.py'], 'message': "Show default attributes for queue

Currently Zaqar will support more built-in/reserved
attributes in queue.
We add two important attributes max_messages_post_size
and max_message_ttl.

So it's very useful for users that if they create a queue without
metadata, when they query queue, Zaqar add those two attributes from
config to queue metadata and then return.
That will not be stuck if config is changed and user also can
know what value it is.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Icf9af8e357b2e2df363cd28ef3ca7f7f97a77744
Implements: blueprint show-default-attributes-for-queue
"}]
commit_message:
Show default attributes for queue

Currently Zaqar will support more built-in/reserved
attributes in queue.
We add two important attributes max_messages_post_size
and max_message_ttl.

So it's very useful for users that if they create a queue without
metadata, when they query queue, Zaqar add those two attributes from
config to queue metadata and then return.
That will not be stuck if config is changed and user also can
know what value it is.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Change-Id: Icf9af8e357b2e2df363cd28ef3ca7f7f97a77744
Implements: blueprint show-default-attributes-for-queue

subject: Add ignore error on virsh destroy
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 18:51:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/environment/teardown/tasks/main.yml'], 'message': "Add ignore error on virsh destroy

* Add ignore error True statement on virsh destroy:
  In case of the network is inactive, virsh destroy
  won't work and will failed ansible workflow
  Ignoring this error could let the quickstart
  undefine the network in the next step.

  Otherwise, we could just undefine the network
  instead of destroying it before

Change-Id: I2de1ffc7bdb03355800aebd0aff1803606997f83
"}]
commit_message:
Add ignore error on virsh destroy

* Add ignore error True statement on virsh destroy:
  In case of the network is inactive, virsh destroy
  won't work and will failed ansible workflow
  Ignoring this error could let the quickstart
  undefine the network in the next step.

  Otherwise, we could just undefine the network
  instead of destroying it before

Change-Id: I2de1ffc7bdb03355800aebd0aff1803606997f83

commit_message:
[OpsManager] Fix wrong name of class

Previously, it was possible to have different names
of class in class yaml file and in manifest. But
after changes which were added in Mitaka [1] the package
loader became stronger and validates this kind of issues

1. Ic8df487d8a7c327f085f9723c251e99fa998c481

Change-Id: I4e9332844c98a9bc38df06469f3069a1a2e8770e
Closes-Bug: #1566233
(cherry picked from commit 07c6faf425c105c7e390294983a6ed2a654824ff)

subject: Fix tinyipa initrd tarballs.openstack.org file name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 09:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': 'Fix tinyipa initrd tarballs.openstack.org file name

The file name that the ironic devstack script is trying to download for
tinyipa mistakenly has ".cpio" in the name when it shouldn't, this patch
removes it.

Change-Id: I00f1856c186709f43513048e2b9634e57dc32410
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tinyipa initrd tarballs.openstack.org file name

The file name that the ironic devstack script is trying to download for
tinyipa mistakenly has ".cpio" in the name when it shouldn't, this patch
removes it.

Change-Id: I00f1856c186709f43513048e2b9634e57dc32410

Previously, it was possible to have different names
of class in class yaml file and in manifest. But
after changes which were added in Mitaka [1] the package
loader became stronger and validates this kind of issues

subject: Don't set html_last_updated_fmt without git
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 05:29:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Don't set html_last_updated_fmt without git

Using a timestamp as value for "html_last_updated_fmt" isn't good
for the reproducible builds initiative from different downstream
distributions because the build result always differs due to the
timestamp in the documentation.
Also when not setting "html_last_updated_fmt", the value can be set
via command line when running "sphinx-build -D".

Change-Id: I508499f97cbd075930e9ec1abf6af268881cc1c7
'}]
commit_message:
Don't set html_last_updated_fmt without git

Using a timestamp as value for "html_last_updated_fmt" isn't good
for the reproducible builds initiative from different downstream
distributions because the build result always differs due to the
timestamp in the documentation.
Also when not setting "html_last_updated_fmt", the value can be set
via command line when running "sphinx-build -D".

Change-Id: I508499f97cbd075930e9ec1abf6af268881cc1c7

Pass correct security groups driver for ML2 plugin

In order to use security groups firewall_driver value should be set
to a correct value for Neutron ML2 plugin

Change-Id: If3f2f07f75c24658bef23f2de072fafa3fe71d5a
Closes-bug: #1563876

commit_message:
Breaking up utils.py

The file elasticsearch/plugins/utils.py is getting large.
Ideally, we should break it up. The IndexingHelper class
could be moved into it's own file.

Change-Id: I2890ea97f5c6856f31f6f0927a7f7b68570efef2
Closes-Bug: #1563072

subject: Adding trove db sync
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-06 18:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp'], 'message': "Adding trove db sync

Trove's db sync mechanism varies from all other puppet modules,
as it is not executed as a flag on the root class. This change
brings it more into alignment with other openstack modules.

Change-Id: Id2eeacad5a7d41016537cc9ba8c84b50c3fd51f0
"}]
commit_message:
Adding trove db sync

Trove's db sync mechanism varies from all other puppet modules,
as it is not executed as a flag on the root class. This change
brings it more into alignment with other openstack modules.

Change-Id: Id2eeacad5a7d41016537cc9ba8c84b50c3fd51f0

subject: Pass firewall_driver to ML2 plugin conf file
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 12:07:41.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/neutron_plugins_ml2_spec.rb', 'manifests/plugins/ml2.pp', 'releasenotes/notes/missing_firewall_driver_ml2-24b48831f2d0e62b.yaml'], 'message': "Pass firewall_driver to ML2 plugin conf file

If Neutron is installed from Ubuntu packages, neutron-server and
openvswitch/linuxbridge agents use separate files to load configuration
related to ML2 plugin. So in order to use security groups firewall_driver
value should be passed to both configuration files
(ml2_conf.ini and openvswitch_agent.ini).

Also set enable_security_group option to $::os_service_default (current
value is the default value) and show warning when it's enabled without
firewall_driver option as it doesn't make sense (security groups won't work)

Change-Id: I9819867251e3c35f252ddbbad1178bff1c585314
(cherry picked from commit 0d7a2ca5aa6c7be0f5e73d2d4bfd766f63e1e3ac)
"}]
commit_message:
Pass firewall_driver to ML2 plugin conf file

If Neutron is installed from Ubuntu packages, neutron-server and
openvswitch/linuxbridge agents use separate files to load configuration
related to ML2 plugin. So in order to use security groups firewall_driver
value should be passed to both configuration files
(ml2_conf.ini and openvswitch_agent.ini).

Also set enable_security_group option to $::os_service_default (current
value is the default value) and show warning when it's enabled without
firewall_driver option as it doesn't make sense (security groups won't work)

Change-Id: I9819867251e3c35f252ddbbad1178bff1c585314
(cherry picked from commit 0d7a2ca5aa6c7be0f5e73d2d4bfd766f63e1e3ac)

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4656, 'name': 'Sean M. Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20084, 'name': 'Intel networking-odl CI', 'email': 'intel-odl-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-networking-odl-ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-11 17:04:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Fix usage of tempest utils during config

Most of the tempest utilities need at least a partially setup
configuration file to work properly. This is because most of them
make api requests in order to perform the expected operations.
This causes a bit of a chicken and egg problem when we rely on
these utilities for configuration purposes since we don't know if
we have enough of a configuration file to run things. This previously
wasn't an issue because all we needed to run was verify-tempest config
and it wasn't in a critical path just for api extension discovery and
it wasn't relied on. But, with the addition of tempest preprovisioned
credentials we rely on a tempest util to create the credentials we
use for running things. We need to ensure the util has as complete of
a config file when it's run to ensure that everything is in the
correct state.

This commit moves the running of all tempest utils and the associated
iniset calls to the end of the configure_tempest function to ensure
that the utils have as complete a config file as possible.
Additionally, it makes all tempest util calls are venv isolated. (which
is mostly future proofing for when things are branched on stable)

Change-Id: I5844aed4e134fbc7210aa0eca83500e260915b7b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix usage of tempest utils during config

Most of the tempest utilities need at least a partially setup
configuration file to work properly. This is because most of them
make api requests in order to perform the expected operations.
This causes a bit of a chicken and egg problem when we rely on
these utilities for configuration purposes since we don't know if
we have enough of a configuration file to run things. This previously
wasn't an issue because all we needed to run was verify-tempest config
and it wasn't in a critical path just for api extension discovery and
it wasn't relied on. But, with the addition of tempest preprovisioned
credentials we rely on a tempest util to create the credentials we
use for running things. We need to ensure the util has as complete of
a config file when it's run to ensure that everything is in the
correct state.

This commit moves the running of all tempest utils and the associated
iniset calls to the end of the configure_tempest function to ensure
that the utils have as complete a config file as possible.
Additionally, it makes all tempest util calls are venv isolated. (which
is mostly future proofing for when things are branched on stable)

Change-Id: I5844aed4e134fbc7210aa0eca83500e260915b7b

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-12-17 21:42:09.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_actions.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_actions.py'], 'message': 'Remove unnecessary VolumeNotFound exceptions

Right now the API catches VolumeNotFound exceptions and raises them
as HTTPNotFound, but the wsgi layer already handles returning 404
in case a non-existant volume is passed in to volume_get, so this
is unnecessary. This patch removes the catching of VolumeNotFound
in the API.

Change-Id: I32b2b16cea5a22710e1e45634a440f67597abe0a
Closes-bug: #1449941
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary VolumeNotFound exceptions

Right now the API catches VolumeNotFound exceptions and raises them
as HTTPNotFound, but the wsgi layer already handles returning 404
in case a non-existant volume is passed in to volume_get, so this
is unnecessary. This patch removes the catching of VolumeNotFound
in the API.

Change-Id: I32b2b16cea5a22710e1e45634a440f67597abe0a
Closes-bug: #1449941

Fix useless-else-on-loop pylint issues

Fixed useless-else-on-loop (warning code W0120:
useless-else-on-loop.) pylint issues.
Please refer:
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/CinderCodeCleanupPatches

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-11-06 03:34:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/test_sheepdog.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/sheepdog.py'], 'message': 'Sheepdog: Improve image operations

This patch changes SheepdogDriver Class methods to use
SheepdogClient Class methods for detailed error logs.

We change the following SheepdogDriver methods.

- clone_image
- copy_image_to_volume
- copy_volume_to_image
- update_volume_stats

SheepdogClient Class methods are implemented to enable
fine grained Error handling.

So, the administrators are enabled to do error recovery
more easily using those logs.

Change-Id: I28a1880d4c1d4d4f5fe578c1b8c71b245fa79f45
'}]
commit_message:
Sheepdog: Improve image operations

This patch changes SheepdogDriver Class methods to use
SheepdogClient Class methods for detailed error logs.

We change the following SheepdogDriver methods.

- clone_image
- copy_image_to_volume
- copy_volume_to_image
- update_volume_stats

SheepdogClient Class methods are implemented to enable
fine grained Error handling.

So, the administrators are enabled to do error recovery
more easily using those logs.

Change-Id: I28a1880d4c1d4d4f5fe578c1b8c71b245fa79f45

commit_message:
Specification for Nailgun API for serialized facts

Provide API with CRUD capability for data sources
of serialized deployment data (or facts). API shall
be consumed by 3rd party applications to
retrieve deployment facts.

Blueprint: serialized-facts-nailgun-api
Change-Id: I1d54a056a48faa94fb01b097281b8c0d636f29a5

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-08-31 04:32:47.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/backup/chunkeddriver.py'], 'message': 'Adjust to right exception for chunkeddriver

Fix the wrong exception for getting the list of object
names during backup deleting. Since the chunkeddriver has
been refactored out as the top abstract backup driver for
swift and nfs, and there might be other backup backend
coming, it should be fit to the proper backend instead
of hardcoded swift. And update log messages beginning
with capital letter in this driver.

Change-Id: Ia4f9fea11b0fc3c15fc1543663826c5915e26ce7
Signed-off-by: Lei Li <li.lei2@hp.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust to right exception for chunkeddriver

Fix the wrong exception for getting the list of object
names during backup deleting. Since the chunkeddriver has
been refactored out as the top abstract backup driver for
swift and nfs, and there might be other backup backend
coming, it should be fit to the proper backend instead
of hardcoded swift. And update log messages beginning
with capital letter in this driver.

Change-Id: Ia4f9fea11b0fc3c15fc1543663826c5915e26ce7
Signed-off-by: Lei Li <li.lei2@hp.com>

commit_message:
Add hive property for Hue < 0.9.0

- Add Hue 3.9.0 to MapR 5.0.0
- Property hive.server2.authentication
  is added to hive-site.xml as it is
  required for Hue versions less than 3.9.0

Change-Id: I7f927c5d8c68aa6e19e08d9bcc1b255051c2a46c
Closes-Bug: #1560081

subject: Configure Neutron to use internalURL for contacting Nova
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 16:40:48.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/roles/neutron/templates/neutron.conf.j2'], 'message': "Configure Neutron to use internalURL for contacting Nova

The Kolla design is for services to use the internalURL for
service to service communication.  In Mitaka, Neutron added
a new config parameter specifying which URL to use to to
contact Nova, making the default 'public'.  This patch sets
the value to 'internal'.

Change-Id: I2d36f3b4a860af9e9034ebfb2b5cea56450e5e4e
Closes-Bug: #1565624
(cherry picked from commit afc2bd83dca75cf5d0f281016af7c0ac46c212e4)
"}]
commit_message:
Configure Neutron to use internalURL for contacting Nova

The Kolla design is for services to use the internalURL for
service to service communication.  In Mitaka, Neutron added
a new config parameter specifying which URL to use to to
contact Nova, making the default 'public'.  This patch sets
the value to 'internal'.

Change-Id: I2d36f3b4a860af9e9034ebfb2b5cea56450e5e4e
Closes-Bug: #1565624
(cherry picked from commit afc2bd83dca75cf5d0f281016af7c0ac46c212e4)

commit_message:
Updated role using the Multi-Distro framework

* The default apt packages have been moved into a var file
  that is only loaded when the detected OS is matched.
* The Install task file has had the apt specific tasks moved
  into a named install task file.

Change-Id: I9bad054a3898a688bd372f91de468ad7d5fa41ec
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
add ipv4 network-isolation to quickstart for virt deployments

This adds an ovs port on the undercloud on the external network.
Adds the required network-environment.yaml file for net-iso template
deployment.  Update the centos/min.yml and centos/ha.yml w/ network
isolation templates and created a new settings file to deploy w/o
network isolation.

Change-Id: If1841710c0e9d9f59a81410e91f460a8088f020c

subject: Heat stack deletion for HOT/TOSCA packages was fixed
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7225, 'name': 'Serg Melikyan', 'email': 'smelikyan@mirantis.com', 'username': 'smelikyan'}, {'_account_id': 7821, 'name': 'Murano CI', 'username': 'murano-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13149, 'name': 'Dmytro Dovbii', 'email': 'dmanddov@gmail.com', 'username': 'Ddovbii'}, {'_account_id': 13323, 'name': 'Tetiana Lashchova', 'email': 'tlashchova@gmail.com', 'username': 'tlashchova'}, {'_account_id': 15168, 'name': 'Kirill Zaitsev', 'email': 'k.zaitsev@me.com', 'username': 'kzaitsev'}, {'_account_id': 18675, 'name': 'Sharath Rao', 'email': 'sharath.rao@ericsson.com', 'username': 'sharath.rao'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-05 15:33:20.000000000', 'files': ['murano/packages/hot_package.py', 'contrib/plugins/murano_heat-translator_plugin/plugin/csar_package.py'], 'message': 'Heat stack deletion for HOT/TOSCA packages was fixed

HeatStack class expects to be owned by some other and uses it to find
OpenStack region name it belongs to. If there is no owner provided then
the default region is used which is random for multi-region setups.

MuranoPL code that was generated from HOT and TOSCA provided that owner
on "deploy" phase but not on "destroy". So the stack that was
successfully created earlier could never be deleted in multi-region
OpenStack installations for non-default region.

Change-Id: I19ca0c7129b073fdd852b22a6a7f84f7ee377ee7
Closes-Bug: #1565777
'}]
commit_message:
Heat stack deletion for HOT/TOSCA packages was fixed

HeatStack class expects to be owned by some other and uses it to find
OpenStack region name it belongs to. If there is no owner provided then
the default region is used which is random for multi-region setups.

MuranoPL code that was generated from HOT and TOSCA provided that owner
on "deploy" phase but not on "destroy". So the stack that was
successfully created earlier could never be deleted in multi-region
OpenStack installations for non-default region.

Change-Id: I19ca0c7129b073fdd852b22a6a7f84f7ee377ee7
Closes-Bug: #1565777

commit_message:
Heat stack deletion for HOT/TOSCA packages was fixed

HeatStack class expects to be owned by some other and uses it to find
OpenStack region name it belongs to. If there is no owner provided then
the default region is used which is random for multi-region setups.

MuranoPL code that was generated from HOT and TOSCA provided that owner
on "deploy" phase but not on "destroy". So the stack that was
successfully created earlier could never be deleted in multi-region
OpenStack installations for non-default region.

Change-Id: I19ca0c7129b073fdd852b22a6a7f84f7ee377ee7
Closes-Bug: #1565777

subject: Set cookiecutter vesrion to 1.3.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 13:24:44.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/bootstrap.sh'], 'message': "Set cookiecutter vesrion to 1.3.0

The latest cookiecutter version (1.4.0) has issues with
poyo dependency for parsing yaml files which are started
from '---' (more info: https://github.com/hackebrot/poyo/issues/3).
To prevent CI falures we need to hard-code cookiecutter version
to 1.3.0. Once poyo issue is resolved we can use latest cookiecutter.

Change-Id: I5f3aed3df29bc5d48a342bd8e7a5fe310360fc7a
"}]
commit_message:
Set cookiecutter vesrion to 1.3.0

The latest cookiecutter version (1.4.0) has issues with
poyo dependency for parsing yaml files which are started
from '---' (more info: https://github.com/hackebrot/poyo/issues/3).
To prevent CI falures we need to hard-code cookiecutter version
to 1.3.0. Once poyo issue is resolved we can use latest cookiecutter.

Change-Id: I5f3aed3df29bc5d48a342bd8e7a5fe310360fc7a

commit_message:
Fixes bug where the updated federated display_name is not returned

When shadowing a federated user, if the display name is changed, it
should get updated and returned in the user name attribute.  This patch
fixes a bug where the display_name was getting updated, but not the old
display_name was being returned.

Closes-Bug: #1566494

Change-Id: I155d3a9e4c90a3d22d0b30e35276c9ddbb65ae6d

commit_message:
Add network resource properties

Add the following Mitaka properties to the network resources:
  - description: FloatingIP, Network, Port, Router,
    SecurityGroupRule, SubnetPool, Subnet (see [1] for details)
  - name: HealthMonitor, PoolMember (see [2] for details)
  - pool_ids: LoadBalancer (see [3] for details)
  - load_balancer_ids: Pool (see [3] for details)
  - created_at, updated_at: Network, Port, Subnet,
    SubnetPool (see [4] for details)
  - is_default: Network (see [5] for details)
  - is_default: SubnetPool (see [6] for details)

Add the following missing properties to the network resources
  - status: FloatingIP
  - health_monitors, listeners, load_balancers, l7_policies,
    pools: Quota

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/269887
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1515506
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/218560
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/213586
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/233306/
[6] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1501328

Change-Id: I18877afe8d625a34d5318331e0d9d96b4ba06ba5

subject: Include newly-labelled HA router interfaces in network config
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 19:31:28.000000000', 'files': ['astara/test/unit/api/test_neutron_wrapper.py', 'astara/api/neutron.py'], 'message': 'Include newly-labelled HA router interfaces in network config

Neutron very recently changed the device_owner field of router
interfaces on HA routers.  We need to account for this when
creating appliance network config, otherwise we omit HA interfaces
from its network config.

Change-Id: Ib41d4255f1ad3180c75f6e89ec6162dfdd0d2796
Closes-bug: #1567623
'}]
commit_message:
Include newly-labelled HA router interfaces in network config

Neutron very recently changed the device_owner field of router
interfaces on HA routers.  We need to account for this when
creating appliance network config, otherwise we omit HA interfaces
from its network config.

Change-Id: Ib41d4255f1ad3180c75f6e89ec6162dfdd0d2796
Closes-bug: #1567623

revisions:

When astara creates allocation config, it has always skipped
service ports (historically VRRP ports), but it currently does not
skip LB ports.  This adds some constants where we can define astara's
service port labels and expand in the future, and takes these into

Closes-bug: #1567163

commit_message:
Skip all types of service ports when creating allocation config

When astara creates allocation config, it has always skipped
service ports (historically VRRP ports), but it currently does not
skip LB ports.  This adds some constants where we can define astara's
service port labels and expand in the future, and takes these into
account when deciding which ports to leave out of allocation config.

Change-Id: I6d815b1e7e6e24120ad7fd9becc94a216bfb625b
Closes-bug: #1567163

subject: Fix FC volume driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 14:23:48.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/test_volumeops.py', 'hyperv/nova/volumeops.py'], 'message': 'Fix FC volume driver

While the rescan_disks method has been moved to diskutils, the FC
volume driver still tries to use it from fc_utils.

Also, the method attempting to retrieve the volume path does not
pass the expected exceptions to the loopingcall.RetryDecorator,
thus no retry being made if the disk can not be found after the
first rescan.

This change fixes those issues.

Closes-Bug: #1568882

Change-Id: I2a1bc7c938dfbe3e02489aa083c6460c4e3c8818
'}]
commit_message:
Fix FC volume driver

While the rescan_disks method has been moved to diskutils, the FC
volume driver still tries to use it from fc_utils.

Also, the method attempting to retrieve the volume path does not
pass the expected exceptions to the loopingcall.RetryDecorator,
thus no retry being made if the disk can not be found after the
first rescan.

This change fixes those issues.

Closes-Bug: #1568882

Change-Id: I2a1bc7c938dfbe3e02489aa083c6460c4e3c8818

subject: Translations: Temporarily stop master sync for python projects
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-12 11:06:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Translations: Temporarily stop master sync for python projects

To allow translation of release notes, we need to change the srcdir
argument for zanata. The locale files stay the same, just the way they
are referenced is different now.

First, we disable syncing of master for projects with one module
(most projects, exceptions include horizon and keystone) temporarily.

Then, a manual update of resources is done.

And finally syncing is enabled again.

This change disables syncing and lays the ground work for how the setup
will be later:
* stable/mitaka will use old setup.
* master for *all* projects will use same settings, so this unifies
  current django and python projects, independent of number of modules.

Change-Id: I9719e256bbd213d9b9265faaf4e4e32632c5d8d7
'}]
commit_message:
Translations: Temporarily stop master sync for python projects

To allow translation of release notes, we need to change the srcdir
argument for zanata. The locale files stay the same, just the way they
are referenced is different now.

First, we disable syncing of master for projects with one module
(most projects, exceptions include horizon and keystone) temporarily.

Then, a manual update of resources is done.

And finally syncing is enabled again.

This change disables syncing and lays the ground work for how the setup
will be later:
* stable/mitaka will use old setup.
* master for *all* projects will use same settings, so this unifies
  current django and python projects, independent of number of modules.

Change-Id: I9719e256bbd213d9b9265faaf4e4e32632c5d8d7

commit_message:
Set log color to false

Current log color implementation in devstack causes tput spam erros. As
far as color log is not useful on CI nodes it was decided to skip
colors.

Closes-Bug: #1568833

commit_message:
Fix Nova test data and selenium tests

This patch squashes two commits, as the commit issues (broken tests)
were blocking each other.

Fix time in Nova test data

A recent update to python-novaclient seems to have highlighted some
incorrect test data, causing our tests to fail. This patch fixes the
time format.

Change-Id: I32a1e54205dd31176c0b7798597b63df544f8d38
Closes-Bug: 1567634
(cherry picked from commit d6afbac57f8982b981ad5afbcbf1a6434d4e4d01)

Fix Selenium Tests

A recent update to XStatic-Jasmine appears to have altered the class
name that a selenium test was looking for. This patch amends the class
so that the test correctly finds the class.

Change-Id: I8d6844cdb14a84bd5498429b8545cdca8ba173b6
Closes-Bug: 1567965
(cherry picked from commit 7661db1ba438a13cf77d64913bfc88767b6bcdae)

commit_message:
Fix Nova test data and selenium tests

This patch squashes two commits, as the commit issues (broken tests)
were blocking each other.

Fix time in Nova test data

A recent update to python-novaclient seems to have highlighted some
incorrect test data, causing our tests to fail. This patch fixes the
time format.

Change-Id: I32a1e54205dd31176c0b7798597b63df544f8d38
Closes-Bug: 1567634
(cherry picked from commit d6afbac57f8982b981ad5afbcbf1a6434d4e4d01)

Fix Selenium Tests

A recent update to XStatic-Jasmine appears to have altered the class
name that a selenium test was looking for. This patch amends the class
so that the test correctly finds the class.

commit_message:
Refactor and fix dummy process fixture

Extracting the test fixture that creates a new process and leaves it
running for a given amount of time into helpers where other fixtures for
functional tests live. This both keeps the fixtures at one place and
increases visibility of the fixture so that it can be reused in other
tests. At the same time, the fixture is fixed as the original code
omitted starting the process.

Change-Id: I97aeb8d1d5773ef3d59e8f908aea34ccceb38378
Related-Bug: 1561046
(cherry picked from commit 2690eed19a749fb1b50bb38f3d01fce0f1497f39)

Closes-Bug: #1512607
Closes-Bug: #1544536
'}]
commit_message:
Added new repos for fuel plugins

- fuel-plugin-detach-swift
current repo: https://github.com/SmartInfrastructures/fuel-plugin-detach-swift
- fuel-plugin-tacker
current repo: https://github.com/michalskalski/fuel-plugin-tacker

These are yet another fuel plugins repositories,
created under Openstack namespace.

These projects met the following criteria:
- development of the plugin has already started under private repo,
- code is available under the open source license,
- current repository do not contain any binary files,
- plugin will support more than one Fuels version,
- there are plans to setup CI.

Change-Id: Ife7c03989bb39fb1fad2af044263324a6baccd85
Closes-Bug: #1512607
Closes-Bug: #1544536

commit_message:
Create tripleo-quickstart subteam

cycle.

revisions:

When the l2population mechanism driver is enabled, if ovs is restarted
tunnel ports are not re-configured in full due to stale ofport handles
in the OVS agent.

Change-Id: If0e034a034a7f000a1c58aa8a43d2c857dee6582

commit_message:
Ensure that tunnels are fully reset on ovs restart

When the l2population mechanism driver is enabled, if ovs is restarted
tunnel ports are not re-configured in full due to stale ofport handles
in the OVS agent.

Reset all handles when OVS is restarted to ensure that tunnels are
fully recreated in this situation.

Change-Id: If0e034a034a7f000a1c58aa8a43d2c857dee6582
Closes-bug: #1460164
(cherry picked from commit 17c14977ce0e2291e911739f8c85838f1c1f3473)

subject: tempest: fix dir_path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 12:16:25.000000000', 'files': ['mistral_tempest_tests/services/base.py'], 'message': "tempest: fix dir_path

This patch fix the dir_path that helps to get the directory of
Mistral resources.

Without this patch, this is what we get when running Tempest:

IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral_mistral/tests/resources/openstack/action_collection_wb.yaml'

With this patch:
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/tests/resources/openstack/action_collection_wb.yaml
This path is correct and Tempest runs successfully.

Change-Id: Ie4bd3db8a4e729f7937a6f3c099d7c25abffcb1b
Closes-Bug: #1568413
(cherry picked from commit 99edd171057daf29d4bf66cafdf282259fbd1e8b)
"}]
commit_message:
tempest: fix dir_path

This patch fix the dir_path that helps to get the directory of
Mistral resources.

Without this patch, this is what we get when running Tempest:

IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral_mistral/tests/resources/openstack/action_collection_wb.yaml'

With this patch:
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/tests/resources/openstack/action_collection_wb.yaml
This path is correct and Tempest runs successfully.

Change-Id: Ie4bd3db8a4e729f7937a6f3c099d7c25abffcb1b
Closes-Bug: #1568413
(cherry picked from commit 99edd171057daf29d4bf66cafdf282259fbd1e8b)

commit_message:
Resolves metadata field output on rest call to  zone import and export

Earlier on REST API call to zones/tasks/imports or zones/tasks/exports,
metadata field was displayed with no key/val pair.
This patch makes {'total_count : #val'} to be be produced as
output in metadata field on execution of those REST API call.

Closes-Bug: #1532925

Change-Id: I566e370edce5f29aafe793d5fdf7fe2fb7b3a856
