revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 12:37:28.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/rpc/receiver.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Remove unnecessary cast to string from 'verify_networks_resp's code"

Unfortunately, `task.cache['args']['nodes']` contains nodes with integer-based UIDs, not string based. Hence, sets with UIDs are considered completely different and we consider all nodes are unreachable. That results to mistakingly setting "error" to "verify_network" task.

This reverts commit 8a0b8af085bd3654812661280befab71090353be.

Change-Id: Ie43bb2017021821b0342eef28e9ec4bd3542d22f
Closes-Bug: #1569140
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove unnecessary cast to string from 'verify_networks_resp's code"

Unfortunately, `task.cache['args']['nodes']` contains nodes with integer-based UIDs, not string based. Hence, sets with UIDs are considered completely different and we consider all nodes are unreachable. That results to mistakingly setting "error" to "verify_network" task.

This reverts commit 8a0b8af085bd3654812661280befab71090353be.

Change-Id: Ie43bb2017021821b0342eef28e9ec4bd3542d22f
Closes-Bug: #1569140

subject: Fix test_import_big_zip_file the mismatch error message
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-12 07:01:58.000000000', 'files': ['muranodashboard/tests/functional/sanity_check.py'], 'message': 'Fix test_import_big_zip_file the mismatch error message

Now test_import_big_zip_file give the error:
"testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: 'Error: 400 Bad Request:
Uploading file is too large. The limit is 5 Mb' not in u'Error:
400 Bad Request Uploading file is too large. The limit is 5 Mb'"

This patch fix it.

Closes-bug: #1569190
Change-Id: I3e3a0e3de7acab4e89d299f8e67a0dc69cb02715
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_import_big_zip_file the mismatch error message

Now test_import_big_zip_file give the error:
"testtools.matchers._impl.MismatchError: 'Error: 400 Bad Request:
Uploading file is too large. The limit is 5 Mb' not in u'Error:
400 Bad Request Uploading file is too large. The limit is 5 Mb'"

This patch fix it.

Closes-bug: #1569190
Change-Id: I3e3a0e3de7acab4e89d299f8e67a0dc69cb02715

Change-Id: I0ab7d5e2d55fe007d35bd0fd2ffcccfc919eb667

commit_message:
Set backup import volume id to real uuid

When we import a backup we put a manufactured volume
id in the imported record.  This commit ensures that
we use a genuine uuid rather than the value
'0000-0000-0000-0000'.

Change-Id: I0ab7d5e2d55fe007d35bd0fd2ffcccfc919eb667

subject: Release glance_store 0.13.1 for stable/mitaka
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-04 20:43:06.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/mitaka/glance-store.yaml'], 'message': 'Release glance_store 0.13.1 for stable/mitaka

The python-swiftclient 3.0.0 release results in test breakage in
glance_store that should be fixed in this 0.13.1 release. stable/mitaka
currently cannot install python-swiftclient 3.0.0 with glance_store
stable/mitaka min requirement of 0.13.0.

Change-Id: I4c6317365315e0d2cf3bc0dcbdd5f655aee3c35f
'}]
commit_message:
Release glance_store 0.13.1 for stable/mitaka

The python-swiftclient 3.0.0 release results in test breakage in
glance_store that should be fixed in this 0.13.1 release. stable/mitaka
currently cannot install python-swiftclient 3.0.0 with glance_store
stable/mitaka min requirement of 0.13.0.

Change-Id: I4c6317365315e0d2cf3bc0dcbdd5f655aee3c35f

Run the functional tests in a more verbose mode

Previously, the cli functional tests would not display each test case
as they ran. This fixes that, similar to how the api functional tests
do this.

commit_message:
Switch from RUN: to ROLE: annotation

* RUN annotation caused duplication for tasks in the old folder
* RUN should only be used if you need non-standard run configuration
* With ROLE annotation there's no need to update all the tests
  when you add new astute.yaml fixture for existing role
* Fix manifest variable in broken tests

Change-Id: I7a1c98bdb51590d8d80cee387de35d5581cf1da2
Partial-bug: #1535339
(cherry picked from commit 6908722cfc9bdd81f34a91d12863d79d0a0130a0)

subject: SAKE OF ARGUMENT - Fix NAT processing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 22:25:40.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_meta.py', 'requirements.txt', 'shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_common.py', 'shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': "SAKE OF ARGUMENT - Fix NAT processing

In a cloud that has multiple private networks and that requires
floating IPs for public access, it's not possible to know which private
network the floating IP should NAT to without the user providing
some configuration. os-client-config added support for expressing
such a thing in 1.17.0, so start consuming that.

Search subnets for gateway_ip to discover NAT dest

The network that should be the target of the NAT of a floatingip should
have a subnet that has a gateway_ip. Ignore for a moment the
monumental insanity which is that data model ... that a network can have
one or more subnets, and a network_id is what a port has and is how you
describe what you want to attach to, but even with all of that the
gateway_ip is the cogent property and it's needs to be on all of the
subnets in the network. Just ignore that ... if you can.

Since that is the world we live in, we can discover which network is the
netowrk that has one or more subnets that has the gateway_ip set.

We'll still fail if there are more than one network that has a subnet
with gateway_ip set. But in that case, the config will take care of it.

Refactor guts of _find_interesting_networks

_find_interesting_networks is very sadly WAY too long and ugly. A
symptom of that was the code being all squished against the 80 column
line - but honestly the problem is that the code is so deep inside of
conditionals that figuring out what's going on is a bit madenning.

Split it out into another method so that the logic of whether we need to
do things can be isolated from the logic of doing things.

Add nat_destination filter to floating IP creation

In Ansible 1.9.x 'quantum_floating_ip' module you have the option
to specify 'internal_network_name'. This allows you to set the name
of the network of the port to associate with the floating ip.

In Ansible 2.x 'os_floating_ip' you can't do that. This change
should bring the 'internal_network_name' option to be supported
for Ansible 2.x version.

Allow passing nat_destination to get_active_server

One of the code paths in which you might want to declare the
nat_destination is if you're calling get_active_server.

Trying to combine len(ports) and nat_network logic led to weird
debugging. Split the two so that we don't try to search for a network to
attach the fip to if there is only one port on the server.

Change-Id: I2b0e55bfb6ec6ba3f31dd58b31680e8e5384b660
"}]
commit_message:
SAKE OF ARGUMENT - Fix NAT processing

In a cloud that has multiple private networks and that requires
floating IPs for public access, it's not possible to know which private
network the floating IP should NAT to without the user providing
some configuration. os-client-config added support for expressing
such a thing in 1.17.0, so start consuming that.

Search subnets for gateway_ip to discover NAT dest

The network that should be the target of the NAT of a floatingip should
have a subnet that has a gateway_ip. Ignore for a moment the
monumental insanity which is that data model ... that a network can have
one or more subnets, and a network_id is what a port has and is how you
describe what you want to attach to, but even with all of that the
gateway_ip is the cogent property and it's needs to be on all of the
subnets in the network. Just ignore that ... if you can.

Since that is the world we live in, we can discover which network is the
netowrk that has one or more subnets that has the gateway_ip set.

We'll still fail if there are more than one network that has a subnet
with gateway_ip set. But in that case, the config will take care of it.

Refactor guts of _find_interesting_networks

_find_interesting_networks is very sadly WAY too long and ugly. A
symptom of that was the code being all squished against the 80 column
line - but honestly the problem is that the code is so deep inside of
conditionals that figuring out what's going on is a bit madenning.

Split it out into another method so that the logic of whether we need to
do things can be isolated from the logic of doing things.

Add nat_destination filter to floating IP creation

In Ansible 1.9.x 'quantum_floating_ip' module you have the option
to specify 'internal_network_name'. This allows you to set the name
of the network of the port to associate with the floating ip.

In Ansible 2.x 'os_floating_ip' you can't do that. This change
should bring the 'internal_network_name' option to be supported
for Ansible 2.x version.

Allow passing nat_destination to get_active_server

One of the code paths in which you might want to declare the
nat_destination is if you're calling get_active_server.

Trying to combine len(ports) and nat_network logic led to weird
debugging. Split the two so that we don't try to search for a network to
attach the fip to if there is only one port on the server.

Change-Id: I2b0e55bfb6ec6ba3f31dd58b31680e8e5384b660

commit_message:
Strong check for puppet transaction report

We should check not only class of report, but value of
resource statuses.

Also we should not use default pid to allow running other puppet
instances

Related-Bug: #1552805
Closes-Bug: #1566582
Change-Id: I1dd0c25891c8d064e0f3ab1a12ddb14698070c17
(cherry picked from commit 2915ad5acfd1f96f575c897337a9dbee107191a7)

subject: Fix FC volume driver
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 11:32:56.000000000', 'files': ['hyperv/tests/unit/test_volumeops.py', 'hyperv/nova/volumeops.py'], 'message': 'Fix FC volume driver

While the rescan_disks method has been moved to diskutils, the FC
volume driver still tries to use it from fc_utils.

Also, the method attempting to retrieve the volume path does not
pass the expected exceptions to the loopingcall.RetryDecorator,
thus no retry being made if the disk can not be found after the
first rescan.

This change fixes those issues.

Closes-Bug: #1568882

Change-Id: I2a1bc7c938dfbe3e02489aa083c6460c4e3c8818
(cherry picked from commit 2e04aed9bb84ab941eee8553782384ec584707f7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix FC volume driver

While the rescan_disks method has been moved to diskutils, the FC
volume driver still tries to use it from fc_utils.

Also, the method attempting to retrieve the volume path does not
pass the expected exceptions to the loopingcall.RetryDecorator,
thus no retry being made if the disk can not be found after the
first rescan.

This change fixes those issues.

Closes-Bug: #1568882

Change-Id: I2a1bc7c938dfbe3e02489aa083c6460c4e3c8818
(cherry picked from commit 2e04aed9bb84ab941eee8553782384ec584707f7)

commit_message:
Implement Glance Glare service

Glance V3 experimental API has been removed in Mitaka in
favour of standalone Glance Artifacts Repository (GLARE) API.

This patch adds a new service, haproxy settings and tests.

Change-Id: I1df8b9aa8698619e726ad583a1a5ad6d5d671e07
Closes-bug: #1555697
(cherry picked from commit 781814fe6d24433184261018d1966de47a2e40a8)

commit_message:
Do not merge. Patch exists for testing os-vif with Nova

There is an experimental job (gate-tempest-dsvm-nova-os-vif)
that trigger devstack to install os-vif library.
And there is a patch to devstack, that install and configure os-vif.
This patch just for checking that everything installed right.

Change-Id: I243e867ad7046217d1219d54224fd144d562e3b0

commit_message:
ovo: Introduce standard attributes to objects

Patch adds hook to NeutronDbObject that checks if db model has standard
attributes. If so, it extends object fields with standard attributes.

Partial-Bug: 1541928

commit_message:
Add build_index convenience script

This makes it easier to see what the current state of the world is. It
builds an index.rst file which makes it possible to see all the files
inline, and gives a count on how many files are missing critical
stanzas.

Change-Id: I06524b330e37ad24f04f364ff43a089fd0ffda78

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1, 'name': 'James E. Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 4264, 'name': 'Matthias Runge', 'email': 'mrunge@redhat.com', 'username': 'mrunge'}, {'_account_id': 20990, 'name': 'Zhili Liu', 'email': 'zhili.liu@ericsson.com', 'username': 'zhilil'}, {'_account_id': 20998, 'name': 'Anthony Lin', 'email': 'anthony.jclin@gmail.com', 'username': 'anthony.lin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-03-08 17:36:37.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/stable-branches.rst'], 'message': "stable: add hint about active maintenance and g-r caps

As we start to review requests to apply the stable:follows-policy
tag to projects, an easy way to know if a project broke stable
branches is if the project version is capped in global-requirements.

This is generally only possible starting with stable/liberty since
that's when we started using upper-constraints and capping in kilo
was by design (defensive rather than reactive).

Take for example Ifa9b07f7c4e93735aec33adb454e920c3c2d7141 which
proposes to cap python-troveclient<2.1.0 in stable/liberty g-r
because a backward incompatible change made to python-troveclient
in 2.1.0 breaks stable/liberty unit tests for trove.

This is a bit odd to think about with respect to stable branch policy,
because it's not actually the stable/liberty branch of
python-troveclient that is the issue, it's trunk python-troveclient
changes breaking stable branches of other projects.

But in this case, the stable maintenance team could use this cap
as justification for not applying the stable:follows-policy tag
to the python-troveclient project since it makes backward incompatible
changes which break stable branches.

Change-Id: I1fbf48168152ac0535d6fb0578200bcccdcb1a6d
Related-Bug: #1538506
"}]
commit_message:
stable: add hint about active maintenance and g-r caps

As we start to review requests to apply the stable:follows-policy
tag to projects, an easy way to know if a project broke stable
branches is if the project version is capped in global-requirements.

This is generally only possible starting with stable/liberty since
that's when we started using upper-constraints and capping in kilo
was by design (defensive rather than reactive).

Take for example Ifa9b07f7c4e93735aec33adb454e920c3c2d7141 which
proposes to cap python-troveclient<2.1.0 in stable/liberty g-r
because a backward incompatible change made to python-troveclient
in 2.1.0 breaks stable/liberty unit tests for trove.

This is a bit odd to think about with respect to stable branch policy,
because it's not actually the stable/liberty branch of
python-troveclient that is the issue, it's trunk python-troveclient
changes breaking stable branches of other projects.

But in this case, the stable maintenance team could use this cap
as justification for not applying the stable:follows-policy tag
to the python-troveclient project since it makes backward incompatible
changes which break stable branches.

Change-Id: I1fbf48168152ac0535d6fb0578200bcccdcb1a6d
Related-Bug: #1538506

Disable links for Congress in Liberty

Our tarballs were uploaded to Launchpad.  Until we move
the tarballs from Launchpad to tarballs.openstack.org,
the download link is broken.  So disable it.

Change-Id: I244c7eeb6b35d6e5338c88bd9f0a8704721c2820

Missing packages running run_tests.sh

results in errors.

commit_message:
Reorg user documentation to be references

The current content of the user documentation are actually very detailed
reference materials for users. It is lengthy, verbose for beginners.
This patch renames the user documentation to be "user references".
Patches following this will propose a getting started style of tutorial.

Change-Id: Idc92e2bf20e0ded280920d922159722f47516512

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-06 15:24:57.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/fuel_web_client.py', 'fuelweb_test/models/nailgun_client.py'], 'message': "Don't update DPDK related info for interfaces

Generally in tests we update networks to interfaces
assignments only, other interface related configuration
is modified in specific tests (for network features).
Remove 'dpdk' from interfaces properties while performing
PUT request as temporary workaround for bug in API.

Change-Id: I926a6655b35ec62f5daf583123b002b6e1b40eb7
Related-bug: #1564102
"}]
commit_message:
Don't update DPDK related info for interfaces

Generally in tests we update networks to interfaces
assignments only, other interface related configuration
is modified in specific tests (for network features).
Remove 'dpdk' from interfaces properties while performing
PUT request as temporary workaround for bug in API.

Change-Id: I926a6655b35ec62f5daf583123b002b6e1b40eb7
Related-bug: #1564102

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-11 17:31:57.000000000', 'files': ['mistral_tempest_tests/services/base.py'], 'message': "tempest: fix dir_path

This patch fix the dir_path that helps to get the directory of
Mistral resources.

Without this patch, this is what we get when running Tempest:

IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral_mistral/tests/resources/openstack/action_collection_wb.yaml'

With this patch:
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/tests/resources/openstack/action_collection_wb.yaml
This path is correct and Tempest runs successfully.

Change-Id: Ie4bd3db8a4e729f7937a6f3c099d7c25abffcb1b
Closes-Bug: #1568413
"}]
commit_message:
tempest: fix dir_path

This patch fix the dir_path that helps to get the directory of
Mistral resources.

Without this patch, this is what we get when running Tempest:

IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral_mistral/tests/resources/openstack/action_collection_wb.yaml'

With this patch:
/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/mistral/tests/resources/openstack/action_collection_wb.yaml
This path is correct and Tempest runs successfully.

Change-Id: Ie4bd3db8a4e729f7937a6f3c099d7c25abffcb1b
Closes-Bug: #1568413

subject: move migrations from extension
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-04-07 13:05:58.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/v2/contrib/migrations.py', 'novaclient/tests/unit/v2/contrib/test_migrations.py', 'novaclient/v2/shell.py', 'novaclient/v2/client.py', 'novaclient/v2/migrations.py', 'novaclient/client.py'], 'message': 'move migrations from extension

As nova stable_api.rst indicated:

As the extension will be removed from Nove V2.1 REST API. So the concept of
core API and extension API is eliminated also. There is no difference between
Nova V2.1 REST API, all of them are part of Nova stable REST API.

We can move all extenstions to common layer and drop concept of
extensions in novaclient.

Change-Id: I24835aaf07437e1e2a6f707e624a2b2309396e27
'}]
commit_message:
move migrations from extension

As nova stable_api.rst indicated:

As the extension will be removed from Nove V2.1 REST API. So the concept of
core API and extension API is eliminated also. There is no difference between
Nova V2.1 REST API, all of them are part of Nova stable REST API.

We can move all extenstions to common layer and drop concept of
extensions in novaclient.

Change-Id: I24835aaf07437e1e2a6f707e624a2b2309396e27

Since there is no equivalent of a force-snapshot-delete,
the normal snapshot-delete should be more robust to
also handle backend errors. In case the backend does not have
the image snapshot anymore, log an info message and succeed the
operation.

Change-Id: I7fe0878dbc07053ac78272b6998513fafa1c36e8
Closes-Bug: #1415905
Related-Bug: #1361926
(cherry picked from commit c776607c4305304f56e779403e1d23ad51e8dcb5)
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: Make snapshot_delete more robust

Since there is no equivalent of a force-snapshot-delete,
the normal snapshot-delete should be more robust to
also handle backend errors. In case the backend does not have
the image snapshot anymore, log an info message and succeed the
operation.

Change-Id: I7fe0878dbc07053ac78272b6998513fafa1c36e8
Closes-Bug: #1415905
Related-Bug: #1361926
(cherry picked from commit c776607c4305304f56e779403e1d23ad51e8dcb5)

commit_message:

Issues with NPM registry were resolved by updating node.js
and NPM, so this job no longer fails and should be switched

'revert' method in the Node class of libvirt driver destroys nodes
by default.

- Remove destroying the environment's nodes before reverting.
  It should be done from outside if necessary, but in case with
  baremetal nodes - it will break the test cases flow based on

blueprint: devops-bare-metal-driver
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary "destroy" argument from Environment's 'revert'

'revert' method in the Node class of libvirt driver destroys nodes
by default.

- Remove destroying the environment's nodes before reverting.
  It should be done from outside if necessary, but in case with
  baremetal nodes - it will break the test cases flow based on
  snapshots/reverts of Fuel master node.

Change-Id: I121c804a5755e7a03a2370ca97816ec088d6c4af
blueprint: devops-bare-metal-driver

subject: Generalize the patch application procedure
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 11:23:58.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_patch_puppet.py', 'octane/util/patch.py'], 'message': 'Generalize the patch application procedure

Current depth for the patch command (-p3) is tied to historical
format of patches to Puppet manifests which used to be based from
/etc/puppet/modules directory.

Change the depth to -p1 generalize patching approach for other
paths in the host file system.

Change-Id: I8538af2192aa29987404fbe130934122997a2625
(cherry picked from commit a4ed2778ab73d3e058bed9c621222774d45bfe32)
'}]
commit_message:
Generalize the patch application procedure

Current depth for the patch command (-p3) is tied to historical
format of patches to Puppet manifests which used to be based from
/etc/puppet/modules directory.

Change the depth to -p1 generalize patching approach for other
paths in the host file system.

Change-Id: I8538af2192aa29987404fbe130934122997a2625
(cherry picked from commit a4ed2778ab73d3e058bed9c621222774d45bfe32)

Move away from locally installed packages and move tempest
requirement to specific requirements file temporarily until
the stable/mitaka g-r situation is sorted.

This is a fix directly made to stable/mitaka.

subject: Backup create does not return status
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 09:46:32.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_backups.py', 'cinder/api/views/backups.py'], 'message': '    Backup create does not return status

    When executing backup create API, output does not
    contain any status of backup being created.

    But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
    it must show status as creating etc.

    This patchset will fix this issue.

    Change-Id: Ied10979a29361471746ba37bea68f8ca16c7269d
    Closes-Bug:#1567342

Change-Id: I01e7e555d83d265c958f1f694d10f0ec2ab227f2
'}]
commit_message:
Backup create does not return status

    When executing backup create API, output does not
    contain any status of backup being created.

    But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
    it must show status as creating etc.

    This patchset will fix this issue.

    Change-Id: Ied10979a29361471746ba37bea68f8ca16c7269d
    Closes-Bug:#1567342

Change-Id: I01e7e555d83d265c958f1f694d10f0ec2ab227f2

commit_message:

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-11 13:16:40.000000000', 'files': ['octane/tests/test_patch_puppet.py', 'octane/util/patch.py'], 'message': 'Generalize the patch application procedure

Current depth for the patch command (-p3) is tied to historical
format of patches to Puppet manifests which used to be based from
/etc/puppet/modules directory.

Change the depth to -p1 generalize patching approach for other

Change-Id: I8538af2192aa29987404fbe130934122997a2625

commit_message:
Generalize the patch application procedure

Current depth for the patch command (-p3) is tied to historical
format of patches to Puppet manifests which used to be based from
/etc/puppet/modules directory.

Change the depth to -p1 generalize patching approach for other
paths in the host file system.

Change-Id: I8538af2192aa29987404fbe130934122997a2625

subject: Fixes regex to handle unversioned auth_url
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-11 15:01:58.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/functional/hooks/post_test_hook.sh'], 'message': "Fixes regex to handle unversioned auth_url

Previously the regex assumed tha auth_url would be of the format
hostname/vX. This updates the regex to handle cases where auth_url
doesn't contain the ending /vX or /.

This might fix the gate breaking for python-novaclient.

Depends-On: I87b313bbb9e9f865be5936e8465ec73e5975a65c
Change-Id: I81234f51d7dcd4087590651148a1302b2936087f
Closes-Bug: 1568527
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes regex to handle unversioned auth_url

Previously the regex assumed tha auth_url would be of the format
hostname/vX. This updates the regex to handle cases where auth_url
doesn't contain the ending /vX or /.

This might fix the gate breaking for python-novaclient.

Depends-On: I87b313bbb9e9f865be5936e8465ec73e5975a65c
Change-Id: I81234f51d7dcd4087590651148a1302b2936087f
Closes-Bug: 1568527

subject: Extract puppet modules patching into utils
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 11:10:22.000000000', 'files': ['octane/util/puppet.py', 'octane/util/patch.py'], 'message': 'Extract puppet modules patching into utils

Add function to patch the puppet modules on the Fuel Master node

commit_message:
Add script to install image build dependencies

In order for automated image builds to run, create
this script that can be called from magnum jobs, to
install needed dependencies for diskimage-builder
and fedora-atomic builds.
That script will be run on the VM that will be
spinned to run the image builds, targetted for ubuntu-trusty.

Change-Id: Icf5a2c79e47e632be2ac49bc9ccc528b4f604eb2
Implements blueprint fedora-atomic-image-build

commit_message:
Migrate compute node resource information to Inventory objects

This does a live migration of compute node resource information from the
current location (in compute_nodes columns) to the new desired location
of records in the inventories table. It only does this if all control
services have been upgraded to a level that understands this.

Related to blueprint compute-node-inventory-newton

Change-Id: Ieda099d3f617713f09315b2b1e932a7c1d6f45c4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-07 14:45:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_fip_ns.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/keepalived.py', 'neutron/agent/l3/item_allocator.py'], 'message': 'DVR: Increase the link-local address pair range

The current dvr_fip_ns.py file has FIP_LL_SUBNET configured
with a subnet prefixlen of /23 which only allows 255 pairs of
link-local addresses to be generated. If the number of routers
per-node increases beyond the 255 limit it raises an assertion.

This patch increases the link-local address cidr to be a /18
to allow for 8K routers. The new range was chosen to not
overlap with the original, allowing for in-place upgrades
without affecting existing routers.

Closes-Bug: #1562110
Change-Id: I6e11622ea9cc74b1d2428757f16aa0de504ac31a
(cherry picked from commit 7b1b8c2de57457c2ec1ed784165a3e10e24151cf)
'}]
commit_message:
DVR: Increase the link-local address pair range

The current dvr_fip_ns.py file has FIP_LL_SUBNET configured
with a subnet prefixlen of /23 which only allows 255 pairs of
link-local addresses to be generated. If the number of routers
per-node increases beyond the 255 limit it raises an assertion.

This patch increases the link-local address cidr to be a /18
to allow for 8K routers. The new range was chosen to not
overlap with the original, allowing for in-place upgrades
without affecting existing routers.

Closes-Bug: #1562110
Change-Id: I6e11622ea9cc74b1d2428757f16aa0de504ac31a
(cherry picked from commit 7b1b8c2de57457c2ec1ed784165a3e10e24151cf)

commit_message:
Switches metering agent to stateless iptables

If state_less parameter is not specified then
neutron-postrouting-bottom rule goes up in POSTROUTING
chain, which causes premature NATing of traffic,
for ex. traffic between internal networks becomes NATed.

Closes-Bug: 1544508
Co-Authored-By: Sergey Belous <sbelous@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I2e0011237d50a59d417cfee01dcd5f9d0da2e7f5
(cherry picked from commit 5d2d1120fcdcd5977d3c760ac1520a841048d456)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-06 12:30:41.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/common/constants.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_securitygroup.py'], 'message': "SG protocol validation to allow numbers or names

SG rule protocol provided is validated against the DB rules'
protocols for both number and name. The filter provided to DB
is modified so that it is queried for records with both the
protocol name and number, instead of exactly the type provided
with the input. The returned DB rule record's protocol field is
validated against the supplied SG protocol field for both name
or number.
This way, user is still allowed to enter protocol name or number
to create a rule, and API compatibility is maintained.

Closes-Bug: #1215181
(cherry picked from commit 913a64cc1175b3bd7efc7abe34895c32bf39a696)

Also squashed the following regression fix:

===

Don't drop 'protocol' from client supplied security_group_rule dict

If protocol was present in the dict, but was None, then it was never
re-instantiated after being popped out of the dict. This later resulted
in KeyError when trying to access the key on the dict.

Change-Id: I4985e7b54117bee3241d7365cb438197a09b9b86
Closes-Bug: #1566327
(cherry picked from commit 5a41caa47a080fdbc1801e2771163734b9790c57)

===

Change-Id: If4ad684e961433b8d9d3ec8fe2810585d3f6a093
"}]
commit_message:
SG protocol validation to allow numbers or names

SG rule protocol provided is validated against the DB rules'
protocols for both number and name. The filter provided to DB
is modified so that it is queried for records with both the
protocol name and number, instead of exactly the type provided
with the input. The returned DB rule record's protocol field is
validated against the supplied SG protocol field for both name
or number.
This way, user is still allowed to enter protocol name or number
to create a rule, and API compatibility is maintained.

Closes-Bug: #1215181
(cherry picked from commit 913a64cc1175b3bd7efc7abe34895c32bf39a696)

Also squashed the following regression fix:

===

Don't drop 'protocol' from client supplied security_group_rule dict

If protocol was present in the dict, but was None, then it was never
re-instantiated after being popped out of the dict. This later resulted
in KeyError when trying to access the key on the dict.

Change-Id: I4985e7b54117bee3241d7365cb438197a09b9b86
Closes-Bug: #1566327
(cherry picked from commit 5a41caa47a080fdbc1801e2771163734b9790c57)

===

Change-Id: If4ad684e961433b8d9d3ec8fe2810585d3f6a093

commit_message:
Check if task deploy supported before cluster serialization

If some tasks in deployment graph have version less
than 2.0.0 than we fallback to granular deploy
method. This check should be done before cluster
serialization, which take more time.

So let's check if task can be executed with task based
method before serialization.

This patch significantly improves performance.

Partial-Bug: #1498365
Change-Id: I5d0fe8ee9b73958ac07e2fda3ed1bd2f29f0e5fb

This patch series adds the ability for a user to specify a tag to be

This tag is then exposed through the metadata API. For example, a user

network, the other to the public Internet. There is currently no
direct way to tell which interface is which. Specifying tags allows
the user to distinguish between the two interfaces.

This patch puts in the place the final user-visible pieces:
  * In the Nova API, support for tags when booting servers
  * In the metadata API, support for querying device metadata

commit_message:
Device tagging user visible changes

This patch series adds the ability for a user to specify a tag to be
applied to a network interface or a disk when booting an instance.
This tag is then exposed through the metadata API. For example, a user
boots a VM with two network interfaces. One is connected to a private
network, the other to the public Internet. There is currently no
direct way to tell which interface is which. Specifying tags allows
the user to distinguish between the two interfaces.

This patch puts in the place the final user-visible pieces:
  * In the Nova API, support for tags when booting servers
  * In the metadata API, support for querying device metadata
  * In the compute manager and rpc api, the required plumbing to make the above
    possible

Implements: blueprint virt-device-role-tagging

Change-Id: I813cbdd12970f0bb15d3d21f260152ca6acaf03b

commit_message:
Make DirectClientException report correct ip and port

When direct_client.direct_get_suffix_hashes raises a
DirectClientException the exception message and variables
should report the replication_ip and replication_port, as
opposed to the ip and port values reported for all other
case when the exception is raised.

Add option to override ip and port reported in
DirectClientException.

Also adds unit tests to verify both cases.

Related-Bug: 1566395
Change-Id: If3d952847c7199f4e9f6164858085367266386d2

Closes-Bug:1566395
"}]
commit_message:
Modified REPLICATE request to use replication_ip

direct_client.direct_get_suffix_hashes doesn't use replication ip and
port for REPLICATE request. Since we have an option of doing
replication in separate network, we can add replication_ip and port
while creating rings if not it will get filled in with the regular
node's ip.

Change-Id: I34067df27042fc3146b795191ab8043ee1aed3ce
Closes-Bug:1566395

commit_message:
Retry updating agents table in case of deadlock

Updating agents table is contantious operation which
can fail often if mysql backend is in multimaster mode.
This could lead to agents flapping and various issues
such as sporadic reschedluing, port binding failures, etc.

Change-Id: Ief392f9a09d86c185dc086055d2cbc1891ff1d7f
Closes-Bug: #1560724
(cherry picked from commit d5e4013556c7144d347ece267c4bd3c8dc87b24f)

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-04-07 16:58:02.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/processing/charts.py', 'tests/unit/task/processing/test_charts.py'], 'message': '[Reports] Fix parallel iteration calc in LoadChart

We have wrong calculation of parallel iteration count in
Load Profile chart. Before that we have add 0.5 to count in
case of partial intersection. Obviously this is wrong. Add proper
calculation of parallel itaration count.

Change-Id: Id64cdf8f55f8ae7d5c317bbcf419561bcf56422e
'}]
commit_message:
[Reports] Fix parallel iteration calc in LoadChart

We have wrong calculation of parallel iteration count in
Load Profile chart. Before that we have add 0.5 to count in
case of partial intersection. Obviously this is wrong. Add proper
calculation of parallel itaration count.

Change-Id: Id64cdf8f55f8ae7d5c317bbcf419561bcf56422e

commit_message:
Switch npm-lint to non-voting for fuel-ui

Switch to non-voting and enable noop gate to unblock merging
till the issues with npm mirrors are fixed.
Relevant story: https://storyboard.openstack.org/?#!/story/2000541

Change-Id: Ib8659c5a8662ee13a666dc655eaf1d12903e42ed

commit_message:
Add note about heat being busted for development

Heat development environments don't work at all.

As such document this so folks avoid them unless they want to
work on making them better.

keep things working.

commit_message:
test_network_ip_availability: Skip IPv6 tests when configured so

Use a class attribute known by the base class so that IPv6 tests
are skipped appropriately when CONF.network_feature_enabled.ipv6
is False.

Closes-Bug: #1561857
Change-Id: I93f76b7f7cd94ff484d2e4507500af97578ac71a
(cherry picked from commit 61a5bcb52e23fa39839c30cb4f13f8a26e115516)

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-08 10:58:25.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/api/test_network_ip_availability.py'], 'message': 'Fix race conditions in IP availability API tests

DHCP port creation is asynchronous with subnet creation.
Therefore there is a time window where, depending on how fast
the DHCP agent honors the request, the DHCP port IP allocation
may or may not be accounted for in the total number of used IP
for the network. To kill the race, do not run dhcp on the
created subnets at all.

Closes-bug: 1563883

Change-Id: Idda25e65d04852d68a3c160cc9deefdb4ee82dcd
(cherry picked from commit 27634bb2ba2637d694c7d0aa5758173d12ef579a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race conditions in IP availability API tests

DHCP port creation is asynchronous with subnet creation.
Therefore there is a time window where, depending on how fast
the DHCP agent honors the request, the DHCP port IP allocation
may or may not be accounted for in the total number of used IP
for the network. To kill the race, do not run dhcp on the
created subnets at all.

Closes-bug: 1563883

Change-Id: Idda25e65d04852d68a3c160cc9deefdb4ee82dcd
(cherry picked from commit 27634bb2ba2637d694c7d0aa5758173d12ef579a)

commit_message:
ovsfw: Remove vlan tag before injecting packets to port

Open vSwitch takes care of vlan tagging in case normal switching is
used. When ingress traffic packets are accepted, the
actions=output:<port_number> is used but we need to explicitly take care
of stripping out the vlan tags.

Closes-Bug: 1564947
Change-Id: If3fc44c9fd1ac0f7bc9dfe9dc48e76352e981f8e
(cherry picked from commit 0f9ec7b72a8ca173b760f20323f90bffefa91681)

commit_message:
Explicitly disable vCenter certificate verification check

Glance with vmware backend by default tries to verify vCenter
certificate, if it cannot verify certificate then glance-api service
cannot start and operate normally.

Also provide noop test case for changed behaviour.

Change-Id: If72880558a70f9743ac27e8c273f2bfdfb2ae215
Closes-bug: #1559067

commit_message:
Add tempest_log_dir variable

This commit overrides tempest_log_dir to point to /var/log/utility,
as that directory is currently assumed in openstack-ansible.

Note that tempest_log_dir will be added to os_tempest in a subsequent
review.

Change-Id: I907b7b416cf03d88c9b015b3265a216c51a0c7da

subject: If a global pip.conf file exists, let the AIO use it for containers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 08:46:55.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml'], 'message': 'If a global pip.conf file exists, let the AIO use it for containers

OpenStack-CI implements a global pip configuration which configures
the use of the OpenStack pypi and wheel mirrors.

This patch implements a check for a global pip configuration file,
then adds this file to the list of files to be copied into the
container cache so that all containers have the configuration.

While most containers end up with a localised pip configuration
which locks them down to the repo server (which will ignore the
glocal config), this is very useful for the repo server which
does not get locked down.

Change-Id: I1058b68f2281c5152fcd4b880fa21121716bc05c
(cherry picked from commit 8d18b13fbfedb59773137013ef438fd85667d374)
'}]
commit_message:
If a global pip.conf file exists, let the AIO use it for containers

OpenStack-CI implements a global pip configuration which configures
the use of the OpenStack pypi and wheel mirrors.

This patch implements a check for a global pip configuration file,
then adds this file to the list of files to be copied into the
container cache so that all containers have the configuration.

While most containers end up with a localised pip configuration
which locks them down to the repo server (which will ignore the
glocal config), this is very useful for the repo server which
does not get locked down.

Change-Id: I1058b68f2281c5152fcd4b880fa21121716bc05c
(cherry picked from commit 8d18b13fbfedb59773137013ef438fd85667d374)

commit_message:
If a global pip.conf file exists, let the AIO use it for containers

OpenStack-CI implements a global pip configuration which configures
the use of the OpenStack pypi and wheel mirrors.

This patch implements a check for a global pip configuration file,
then adds this file to the list of files to be copied into the
container cache so that all containers have the configuration.

While most containers end up with a localised pip configuration
which locks them down to the repo server (which will ignore the
glocal config), this is very useful for the repo server which
does not get locked down.

Change-Id: I1058b68f2281c5152fcd4b880fa21121716bc05c

subject: Fix doc build if git is absent
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-08 14:50:14.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'message': 'Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I3c55983a29150bb4f3742df5efa068f339ee1cd7
Closes-Bug: #1552251
'}]
commit_message:
Fix doc build if git is absent

When building packages if git is absent, then we should not set
html_last_updated_fmt. It can still be set via the -D switch
when building with sphinx-build.

Change-Id: I3c55983a29150bb4f3742df5efa068f339ee1cd7
Closes-Bug: #1552251

commit_message:
Fix logic for enabling 'swiftcheck' service

Currently used logic for enabling swiftcheck service is
not correct. Additional checks for Keystone availability
from Swift node should be added to HAProxy if management VIP
and Swift proxy IP addresses are from different L3 networks.

Change-Id: I9513fc9da02abdc24cc61a60c33181bb0fc9235b
Related-bug: #1548275
(cherry picked from commit 766335df60c98b610748072b1f1663d482574a72)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-21 16:19:41.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Eager load columns in volume_get_active_by_window

All other volume-related methods in db.sqlalchemy.api are eager loading
volume_metadata, volume_admin_metadata (if admin), volume_type,
volume_attachment and consistencygroup. volume_get_active_by_window
wasn't, causing fails because of SQLAlchemy Session being closed when
trying to lazy load volume_metadata. This commit adds missing
options(joinedload()) to this query.

Change-Id: I33ec89d7f1f43aae6010aaa6e12951b7c522b8f0
Closes-Bug: 1517763
Related-Bug: 1501838
"}]
commit_message:
Eager load columns in volume_get_active_by_window

All other volume-related methods in db.sqlalchemy.api are eager loading
volume_metadata, volume_admin_metadata (if admin), volume_type,
volume_attachment and consistencygroup. volume_get_active_by_window
wasn't, causing fails because of SQLAlchemy Session being closed when
trying to lazy load volume_metadata. This commit adds missing
options(joinedload()) to this query.

Change-Id: I33ec89d7f1f43aae6010aaa6e12951b7c522b8f0
Closes-Bug: 1517763
Related-Bug: 1501838

commit_message:
Correctly configure Spark with Hive, HBase

- Correctly determine where Hive and
  Hbase are installed.
- Add property to hbase-site.xml to
  correctly integrate Hbase with Spark.
- Install mapr-hive and mapr-hbase packages
  on Spark node when Hive and HBase are
  installed on nodes different from Spark.
- Copy hive-site.xml and hbase-site.xml to
  Spark node.

Change-Id: I0087cba69d8d1225c0baa0c7e31fb139aa57cb4a
Closes-Bug: #1560027

fix update controller handler network settings:
* do not remove predefined networks
* set up segment id to net04
* set up physnet as empty string to net04_ext
* set up network_type as local to net04_ext

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-11 18:15:44.000000000', 'files': ['environments/puppet-tenant-vlan.yaml', 'environments/manage-firewall.yaml', 'environments/updates/update-from-keystone-admin-internal-api.yaml', 'environments/docker.yaml', 'environments/puppet-ceph-devel.yaml', 'environments/mongodb-nojournal.yaml'], 'message': 'Always use parameter_defaults in environment files

In the environments/ subdirectory of tripleo-heat-templates, we mostly
use parameter_defaults, but some of the environment files still use
parameters. This can lead to confusing behavior with respect to
parameter priority when passing environment files to deploy/update
commands. Users might expect that subsequent environment files take
priority over preceding ones, but that might not be the case if the
preceding environment files use `parameters`, while the subsequent ones
use `parameter_defaults`.

This commit switches all `parameters:` uses in environments/
subdirectory to `parameter_defaults:`.

Change-Id: Ie4c03c7e7f5a5004a0384d35817135f357e9719b
Closes-Bug: #1567837
'}]
commit_message:
Always use parameter_defaults in environment files

In the environments/ subdirectory of tripleo-heat-templates, we mostly
use parameter_defaults, but some of the environment files still use
parameters. This can lead to confusing behavior with respect to
parameter priority when passing environment files to deploy/update
commands. Users might expect that subsequent environment files take
priority over preceding ones, but that might not be the case if the
preceding environment files use `parameters`, while the subsequent ones
use `parameter_defaults`.

This commit switches all `parameters:` uses in environments/
subdirectory to `parameter_defaults:`.

Change-Id: Ie4c03c7e7f5a5004a0384d35817135f357e9719b
Closes-Bug: #1567837

subject: Asynchronous job management(part 2)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-12 06:55:10.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/db/api.py', 'tricircle/common/constants.py', 'tricircle/xjob/xmanager.py', 'tricircle/common/xrpcapi.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/xjob/test_xmanager.py'], 'message': "Asynchronous job management(part 2)

Implement asynchronous job management to ensure jobs can be
successfully completed even if those jobs temporally fail
for some reasons. The detailed design can be found in section
9 in design document.

This patch focuses on enabling workers to rerun failed job.
Workers started with configuration option 'periodic_enable'
set to 'True' are responsible to this work.

Purging old job records will be covered in later patches.

Change-Id: I2631a98af67e663f929f293bdfb7e7779fe8018e
"}]
commit_message:
Asynchronous job management(part 2)

Implement asynchronous job management to ensure jobs can be
successfully completed even if those jobs temporally fail
for some reasons. The detailed design can be found in section
9 in design document.

This patch focuses on enabling workers to rerun failed job.
Workers started with configuration option 'periodic_enable'
set to 'True' are responsible to this work.

Purging old job records will be covered in later patches.

Change-Id: I2631a98af67e663f929f293bdfb7e7779fe8018e

commit_message:
Retire openstack-ansible-os_swift_sync repository

The content from the openstack-ansible-os_swift_sync repository has
been merged into the openstack-ansible-os_swift repository and is
therefore no longer needed.

This patch implements the retirement of the os_swift_sync
repository content as per [1].

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/drivers.html#retiring-a-project

Needed-By: I47c126dd6186f3b045110d00143036ebf60275e9
Change-Id: Idb70740db0f51b3f445bae2dd99bbc4fbb7b9862

commit_message:
Set permissions on /dev/kvm

Due to a bug in qemu packages (LP #1057024) sometimes /dev/kvm is created with
wrong permissions, it prevents nova-compute from starting vms.
So correct access rules should be explicitly applied while packages are broken

Change-Id: Ib07880fe607203e7bc690a1046a2fe4eebb580be
Closes-bug: #1555029

subject: Fix incompatible keystoneclient version
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-22 18:48:11.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Fix incompatible keystoneclient version

Keystonemiddleware has uncapped keystoneclient as its dependency.
Keystonemiddleware code in liberty branch is incompatible
with latest version of keystoneclient. It only works with
liberty version of keystoneclient. This fix caps the
the liberty version of keystonemiddleware to liberty verison of
keystoneclient

Change-Id: Ib94896e025b237aad6297e1312c16af755d0183f
Closes-Bug: 1548455
'}]
commit_message:
Fix incompatible keystoneclient version

Keystonemiddleware has uncapped keystoneclient as its dependency.
Keystonemiddleware code in liberty branch is incompatible
with latest version of keystoneclient. It only works with
liberty version of keystoneclient. This fix caps the
the liberty version of keystonemiddleware to liberty verison of
keystoneclient

Change-Id: Ib94896e025b237aad6297e1312c16af755d0183f
Closes-Bug: 1548455

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-11 08:29:03.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/swift/proxy.pp'], 'message': 'Fix scan target arg format for swiftcheck service

As second argument swiftcheck utility takes IP and
TCP port of Keystone service (joined by ":" symbol).
Since in just checks TCP port connectivity using netcat
it doesn't require a type of application layer protocol.

Change-Id: Ie6fcbafde8a2458a2528ed67dc64492daac39bcf
Closes-bug: #1548275
(cherry picked from commit 99d9e97118943e0bb59ed33f9c99be47221fe281)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix scan target arg format for swiftcheck service

As second argument swiftcheck utility takes IP and
TCP port of Keystone service (joined by ":" symbol).
Since in just checks TCP port connectivity using netcat
it doesn't require a type of application layer protocol.

Change-Id: Ie6fcbafde8a2458a2528ed67dc64492daac39bcf
Closes-bug: #1548275
(cherry picked from commit 99d9e97118943e0bb59ed33f9c99be47221fe281)

commit_message:
[OpsManager] Fix wrong name of class

Previously, it was possible to have different names
of class in class yaml file and in manifest. But
after changes which were added in Mitaka [1] the package
loader became stronger and validates this kind of issues

1. Ic8df487d8a7c327f085f9723c251e99fa998c481

Change-Id: I4e9332844c98a9bc38df06469f3069a1a2e8770e
Closes-Bug: #1566233

commit_message:
[OpsManager] Remove config() function usage

Recently ability to use config() function from murano apllication
was removed. So, we can't use it anymore and we have to ask keystone
identity url from user.

Change-Id: Ibcaaf99c1ed2fa917c3df8f6eac6d2b4ab73494f
Closes-Bug: #1566235

commit_message:
re-org existing manually install notes

- move enabling service notifications into own section
- clean up copy/paste install instructions
- add note to inform performance boast by disabling message signing
- add note to inform API is not required if Gnocchi is used.
- clean up oslo.messaging items
- remove verbose notes
    - zmq not ready
    - how to use PasteDeploy
- move customisation possibilites into it's own page

Change-Id: Ia42ceec7d2b6c054d065f905b8c0bce1685119aa

subject: copy_puppet_logs: copy audit.log if it does exist
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-11 23:32:31.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/copy_puppet_logs.sh'], 'message': 'copy_puppet_logs: copy audit.log if it does exist

/var/log/audit/audit.log contains SElinux logs that we sometimes need
for debug, since Puppet OpenStack CI is running SElinux in enforced
mode.

This file will be useful for us so we would like to copy it from nodes.

commit_message:
copy_puppet_logs: copy audit.log if it does exist

/var/log/audit/audit.log contains SElinux logs that we sometimes need
for debug, since Puppet OpenStack CI is running SElinux in enforced
mode.

This file will be useful for us so we would like to copy it from nodes.

Change-Id: Ic554dcad8d28b9cbc612019002b19982c53e74f7

commit_message:
Fix Hue integration with Spark and Hive

- When Spark and Hue are installed on different nodes
  hue-livy must be installed on the Spark node.
- Change permissions for hue-livy directory.
- Connect to hive server address instead of metastore.

Closes-Bug: #1560118
Change-Id: Ie036b10d776e24c2feb45039bff81853a39373ec

[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-04-11 09:14:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/utils.py'], 'message': "Fix max concurrent builds's unlimited semaphore

When booting an instance with the config paramter
max_concurrent_builds set to 0, a TypeError is logged in the compute
log. This doesn't prevent the instance from booting, but could be
confusing to someone debugging a different issue. This patch fixes
this issue by fixing the method signature of the __exit__ method of
compute utils's UnlimitedSemaphore. UnlimitedSemaphore was bypassed
entirely in unit tests because the default value for
max_concurrent_builds is 10.

Closes-bug: 1520633
Change-Id: I15825eb3fb1bccb12f4a9148809495ce3e83e3c8
"}]
commit_message:
Fix max concurrent builds's unlimited semaphore

When booting an instance with the config paramter
max_concurrent_builds set to 0, a TypeError is logged in the compute
log. This doesn't prevent the instance from booting, but could be
confusing to someone debugging a different issue. This patch fixes
this issue by fixing the method signature of the __exit__ method of
compute utils's UnlimitedSemaphore. UnlimitedSemaphore was bypassed
entirely in unit tests because the default value for
max_concurrent_builds is 10.

Closes-bug: 1520633
Change-Id: I15825eb3fb1bccb12f4a9148809495ce3e83e3c8

commit_message:
[Verify] Fixing Tempest resources context to create network resources

Tempest resources context fails to create network resources because
Neutron raises the 'BadRequest: Invalid input for tenant_id. Reason:
'None' is not a valid string.' exception.
The issue was introduced by https://review.openstack.org/#/c/282918/.
So this patch is intended to fix the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1550848

Change-Id: I33b0bb2cdec55acf8446b0fab04e34c9f200fafd

commit_message:
Asynchronous job management(part 2)

Implement asynchronous job management to ensure jobs can be
successfully completed even if those jobs temporally fail
for some reasons. The detailed design can be found in section
9 in design document.

This patch focuses on enabling workers to rerun failed job.
Workers started with configuration option 'periodic_enable'
set to 'True' are responsible to this work.

Purging old job records will be covered in later patches.

Change-Id: I2631a98af67e663f929f293bdfb7e7779fe8018e

subject: Remove unknown parameters in patched update
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-04-06 22:14:39.000000000', 'files': ['heat_integrationtests/functional/test_template_resource.py', 'heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_update.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': "Remove unknown parameters in patched update

When updating a stack with the existing flag, we keep the parameters
from the old template to be used against the new version. Sometimes
parameters will get remove and won't make sense anymore, and keeping
them would break update with a 'Parameter was not defined' error. This
filters out such parameters so that the updates succeed.

Change-Id: I6f2aa77da28d271dd001a137bb574b5470292f15
Closes-Bug: #1558610
(cherry picked from commit 90fc4fe89e76e18df8831e1163c064eae76fbf69)
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unknown parameters in patched update

When updating a stack with the existing flag, we keep the parameters
from the old template to be used against the new version. Sometimes
parameters will get remove and won't make sense anymore, and keeping
them would break update with a 'Parameter was not defined' error. This
filters out such parameters so that the updates succeed.

Change-Id: I6f2aa77da28d271dd001a137bb574b5470292f15
Closes-Bug: #1558610
(cherry picked from commit 90fc4fe89e76e18df8831e1163c064eae76fbf69)

commit_message:
Move gate-tempest-dsvm-neutron-dvr to gate queue

The job has held remarkably well [1], sometimes outperforming the
full job (non-dvr version) in the check queue. It is time to move
it to the gate queue where it is also supposed to be.

[1] http://grafana.openstack.org/dashboard/db/neutron-failure-rate?panelId=6&fullscreen

Change-Id: I56b7ebbe2f145ce44a625b8f944cd58dc295cc58

commit_message:
Add quotes for RBMQ nodes definition

erlang parser, cant parse hostname with minus symbol, it returns:
Ignoring external configuration due to error: {1,erl_parse,"bad term"}

Adding single quotes fix this issue.

Co-Authored-By: weiyu <weiyu@unitedstack.com>
Closes-Bug: #1540234
Change-Id: I80e0789aa31febd552a851e6dc3a835d89c0e9d1
(cherry picked from commit 7829aa27b316ea69cb782ac89d705a3a731ba247)

commit_message:
Move away from locally installed packages

Otherwise we'd continue to pull tempest from source.
Ultimately we'd need to move away from pulling tempest by
switching to using the plugin model [1], but this is an
interim step until that can be done.

[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/tempest/plugin.html

Change-Id: I033c035be4e72a56badd1283322bf92c12fcf13d

commit_message:
Values for [ml2]/physical_network_mtus should not be unique

Obviously there could be physical networks with same MTU.
The patch sets unique_values to False when parsing physical_network_mtus
Unit test added.

Closes-Bug: #1567502
Change-Id: I46e5b5d3f7033a974fca40342af6dff7c71a9a4a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-08 06:31:10.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_agentschedulers_db.py'], 'message': 'Use new DB context when checking if agent is online during rescheduling

Commit 9ec466cd42de94c2fad091edfd7583a5f47eb87a was not enough
since it checked l3 agents in the same transaction that was used
to fetch down bindings - so agents always were down even if actually
they went back online.
This commit adds context creation on each iteration to make sure
we use new transaction and fetch up-to-date info for the agent.

Closes-Bug: #1522436
Change-Id: I12a4e4f4e0c2042f0c0bf7eead42baca7b87a22b
'}]
commit_message:
Use new DB context when checking if agent is online during rescheduling

Commit 9ec466cd42de94c2fad091edfd7583a5f47eb87a was not enough
since it checked l3 agents in the same transaction that was used
to fetch down bindings - so agents always were down even if actually
they went back online.
This commit adds context creation on each iteration to make sure
we use new transaction and fetch up-to-date info for the agent.

Closes-Bug: #1522436
Change-Id: I12a4e4f4e0c2042f0c0bf7eead42baca7b87a22b

This is required to run this script in a periodic job, since infra

Change-Id: I8c2ffbc68fd36759924e9ab2a1eb64be390d4756

commit_message:
milestone-review-dash detect current milestone

This patch makes the milestone arg optional. If it's not passed
the script will detect and use the current milestone.
This is required to run this script in a periodic job, since infra
won't accept hard-code parameters.

Change-Id: I8c2ffbc68fd36759924e9ab2a1eb64be390d4756
